The du'a is: -أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ اَللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ التَّوَّابِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِيْنَ Meaning: I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, alone, without any partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His messenger. O Allah, make me among those who constantly repent and make me among those who purify themselves.

Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 55 (authenticated by Ahmad Shakir)

Narrated Jabir bin `Abdullah, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يَسْمَعُ النِّدَاءَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ حَلَّتْ لَهُ شَفَاعَتِي يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Whoever after listening to the Adhan says, :اَللّهُمَّ رَبَّ هذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّداً الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَاماً مَّحْمُوْداً الَّذِيْ وَعَدْتَّهُ‘ [O Allah! Lord of this perfect call (perfect by not ascribing partners to You) and of the regular prayer which is going to be established, give Muhammad the right of intercession and illustriousness, and resurrect him to the best and the highest place in Paradise that You promised him (of)], then my intercession for him will be allowed on the Day of Resurrection".

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 614 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 587 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Nu'man b. Bashir reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

الْمُسْلِمُونَ كَرَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ إِنِ اشْتَكَى عَيْنُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ وَإِنِ اشْتَكَى رَأْسُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ

The similitude of believers regarding mutual love, affection, and fellow-feeling is that of one body; when any limb of it aches, the whole body aches, because of sleeplessness and fever.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2586 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6353 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported that a person came to Allah, 's Messenger (ﷺ) and said,

قَالَ رَجُلٌ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِحُسْنِ الصُّحْبَةِ قَالَ « أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أَبُوكَ ثُمَّ أَدْنَاكَ أَدْنَاكَ »

“O Messenger of Allah! Who among the people is most deserving of my good treatment?” He (the Prophet ﷺ) replied, “Your mother.” The man asked again, “Then who?” He said, “Your mother.” He asked a third time, “Then who?” He said, “Your mother.” Then the man asked, “Then who?” The Prophet said, “Your father. Then (in order) your nearest relative, and then the next nearest.”

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2548 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6270 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) as saying,

« رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ». قِيلَ مَنْ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قَالَ « مَنْ أَدْرَكَ أَبَوَيْهِ عِنْدَ الْكِبَرِ أَحَدَهُمَا أَوْ كِلَيْهِمَا فَلَمْ يَدْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ »

Let him be humbled into dust; let him be humbled into dust. It was said: Allah's Messenger, who is he? He said: He who sees either of his parents during their old age, or he sees both of them, but he does not enter Paradise.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2551 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6279 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

'Abdullah b. Umar reported Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) as saying,

أَبَرُّ الْبِرِّ أَنْ يَصِلَ الرَّجُلُ وُدَّ أَبِيهِ

The finest act of goodness is that a person should treat kindly the loved ones of his father.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2552 (Fuad Abdul Baqi verified), 6283 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Nawwas b. Sam'an al-Ansari reported:

سَأَلْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- عَنِ الْبِرِّ وَالإِثْمِ فَقَالَ « الْبِرُّ حُسْنُ الْخُلُقِ وَالإِثْمُ مَا حَاكَ فِى صَدْرِكَ وَكَرِهْتَ أَنْ يَطَّلِعَ عَلَيْهِ النَّاسُ »

I asked Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) about virtue and vice. He said: Virtue is a kind disposition and vice is what rankles in your heart and that you disapprove that people should come to know of it.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2553 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6285 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

'A'isha reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

الرَّحِمُ مُعَلَّقَةٌ بِالْعَرْشِ تَقُولُ مَنْ وَصَلَنِى وَصَلَهُ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ قَطَعَنِى قَطَعَهُ اللَّهُ

The tie of kinship is suspended to the Throne and says: He who unites me, Allah would unite him, and he who severed me, Allah would sever him.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2555 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6288 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
That is, whoever maintains the ties of kinship, Allah maintains His connection with them and loves them. But whoever severs the ties of kinship, Allah severs His connection with them and dislikes them.

Abu Ayyub Ansiri reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

لاَ يَحِلُّ لِمُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَهْجُرَ أَخَاهُ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثِ لَيَالٍ يَلْتَقِيَانِ فَيُعْرِضُ هَذَا وَيُعْرِضُ هَذَا وَخَيْرُهُمَا الَّذِى يَبْدَأُ بِالسَّلاَمِ

It is not permissible for a Muslim to have estranged relations with his brother beyond three nights, the one turning one way and the other turning the other way when they meet; the better of the two is the first to give a greeting.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2560 (Fuad Abdul Baqi verified), 6300 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَقُولُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ أَيْنَ الْمُتَحَابُّونَ بِجَلاَلِى الْيَوْمَ أُظِلُّهُمْ فِى ظِلِّى يَوْمَ لاَ ظِلَّ إِلاَّ ظِلِّى

Verily, Allah would say on the Day of Resurrection: Where are those who have mutual love for My Glory's sake? Today I shall shelter them in My shadow when there is no other shadow but the shadow of Mine.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2566 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6315 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
This reward is for those who love one another solely for the sake of Allah’s pleasure, without any worldly interest behind their love. When Muslims love each other as brothers in faith, that love is also included in this category.

Abu Rabi' reported directly from Allah's Apostle (may peace be upon him) as saying,

عَائِدُ الْمَرِيضِ فِى مَخْرَفَةِ الْجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَرْجِعَ

The one who visits the sick is, in fact, like one who is in the fruit garden of Paradise, so long as he does not return.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2568 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6317 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

'Abdullah reported, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

مَا مِنْ مُسْلِمٍ يُصِيبُهُ أَذًى مِنْ مَرَضٍ فَمَا سِوَاهُ إِلاَّ حَطَّ اللَّهُ بِهِ سَيِّئَاتِهِ كَمَا تَحُطُّ الشَّجَرَةُ وَرَقَهَا

When a Muslim falls ill, his compensation is that his minor sins are obliterated just as leaves fall (in autumn).

Sahih Mulsim, Hadith 2571 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6325 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

ʿĀʾishah (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُؤْمِنَ مِنْ شَوْكَةٍ فَمَا فَوْقَهَا إِلاَّ رَفَعَهُ اللَّهُ بِهَا دَرَجَةً أَوْ حَطَّ عَنْهُ بِهَا خَطِيئَةً

If a believer suffers even the prick of a single thorn, or anything more minor than that, Allah elevates his rank by one degree or removes from him one sin.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2572 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6328 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Sa'id and abu Huraira reported that they heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

مَا يُصِيبُ الْمُؤْمِنَ مِنْ وَصَبٍ وَلاَ نَصَبٍ وَلاَ سَقَمٍ وَلاَ حَزَنٍ حَتَّى الْهَمِّ يُهَمُّهُ إِلاَّ كُفِّرَ بِهِ مِنْ سَيِّئَاتِهِ

Never a believer is stricken with discomfort, hardship, or illness, grief, or even with mental worry that his sins are not expiated for him.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2573 (Fuad Abdul Baqi verified), 6334 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abū Dharr (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said that Allah, the Exalted, says,

يَا عِبَادِى إِنِّى حَرَّمْتُ الظُّلْمَ عَلَى نَفْسِى وَجَعَلْتُهُ بَيْنَكُمْ مُحَرَّمًا فَلاَ تَظَالَمُوا

I have forbidden oppression for Myself, and I have made it forbidden among you, so do not wrong one another.

Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Ḥadīth 2577 (authenticated by Fu’ād ʿAbd al-Bāqī), 6339 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Salim reported on the authority of his father that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

الْمُسْلِمُ أَخُو الْمُسْلِمِ لاَ يَظْلِمُهُ وَلاَ يُسْلِمُهُ مَنْ كَانَ فِى حَاجَةِ أَخِيهِ كَانَ اللَّهُ فِى حَاجَتِهِ وَمَنْ فَرَّجَ عَنْ مُسْلِمٍ كُرْبَةً فَرَّجَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ بِهَا كُرْبَةً مِنْ كُرَبِ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ وَمَنْ سَتَرَ مُسْلِمًا سَتَرَهُ اللَّهُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

A Muslim is the brother of a fellow-Muslim. He should neither commit oppression upon him nor ruin him, and he who meets the need of a brot'ier, Allah would meet big needs, and he who relieved a Muslim from hardship Allah would relieve him from the difficulties to which he would be put on the Day of Resurrection, and he who did not expose (the follies of a Muslim) Allah would conceal his follies on the Day of Resurrection.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2580 (Fuad Abdul Baqi verified), 6342 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Anas b. Malik reported that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَيَرْضَى عَنِ الْعَبْدِ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ الأَكْلَةَ فَيَحْمَدَهُ عَلَيْهَا أَوْ يَشْرَبَ الشَّرْبَةَ فَيَحْمَدَهُ عَلَيْهَا

Allah is pleased with His servant who says: Al-Hamdu lillah while taking a morsel of food and while drinking.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2734 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Jabir bin Abdullah narrated that the Messenger of Allah said,

كُلُّ مَعْرُوفٍ صَدَقَةٌ ، وَإِنَّ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ أَنْ تَلْقَى أَخَاكَ بِوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ ، وَأَنْ تُفْرِغَ مِنْ دَلْوِكَ فِي إِنَاءِ أَخِيكَ

Every good is charity. Indeed, among the good is to meet your brother with a smiling face, and to pour what is left in your bucket into the vessel of your brother.

Jami At-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1970 (Verified by Ahmad Shaker), 1976 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Hurairah narrated,

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ الرَّاشِيَ وَالمُرْتَشِيَ فِي الحُكْمِ

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) cursed the one who bribes and the one who takes a bribe for a judgement.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1336 (authenticated by Ahmad Shakir), 1340 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Narrated Abu Huraira, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ سُبْحَانَ اللهِ الْعَظِيم

(The following are) two words (sentences or utterances) that are very easy for the tongue to say, and very heavy in the balance (of reward), and most beloved to the Gracious Almighty (And they are): Subhan Allahi wa bi-hamdihi; Subhan Allahi-l-'Adhim,

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6682 (authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6225 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Abu Ad-Darda [may Allah be pleased with him] narrated that, the Prophet said,

أَلاَ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ بِخَيْرِ أَعْمَالِكُمْ ، وَأَزْكَاهَا عِنْدَ مَلِيكِكُمْ ، وَأَرْفَعِهَا فِي دَرَجَاتِكُمْ وَخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ إِنْفَاقِ الذَّهَبِ وَالوَرِقِ ، وَخَيْرٌ لَكُمْ مِنْ أَنْ تَلْقَوْا عَدُوَّكُمْ فَتَضْرِبُوا أَعْنَاقَهُمْ وَيَضْرِبُوا أَعْنَاقَكُمْ ؟ قَالُوا : بَلَى. قَالَ : ذِكْرُ اللهِ تَعَالَى قَالَ مُعَاذُ بْنُ جَبَلٍ : مَا شَيْءٌ أَنْجَى مِنْ عَذَابِ اللهِ مِنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ.

Should I not inform you of the best of your deed, and the purest of them with your Master, and the highest of them in your ranks, and what is better for you than spending gold and silver, and better for you than meeting your enemy and striking their necks, and they strike your necks?” They said: “Of course.” He said, “The remembrance of Allah [Most High].” [Then] Mu’adh bin Jabal [may Allah be pleased with him] said: “There is nothing that brings more salvation from the punishment of Allah than the remembrance of Allah.

Jami\` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3377, (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
Dhikr means remembering. Verbally saying phrases such as SubhanAllah (Glory be to Allah), Alhamdulillah (All praise is due to Allah), etc., is a form of dhikr. Likewise, discussing matters related to Allah the Exalted or matters of the religion is also dhikr.

Narrated Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا خَرَجَ ثَلاَثَةٌ فِى سَفَرٍ فَلْيُؤَمِّرُوا أَحَدَهُمْ

When three people set out on a journey, they should appoint one among them as their leader (Amir).

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 2608 (verified by Shu'aib Arnaout), 2600 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ سَلَكَ طَرِيقًا يَلْتَمِسُ فِيهِ عِلْمًا سَهَّلَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِهِ طَرِيقًا إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ وَمَا اجْتَمَعَ قَوْمٌ فِى بَيْتٍ مِنْ بُيُوتِ اللَّهِ يَتْلُونَ كِتَابَ اللَّهِ وَيَتَدَارَسُونَهُ بَيْنَهُمْ إِلاَّ نَزَلَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّكِينَةُ وَغَشِيَتْهُمُ الرَّحْمَةُ وَحَفَّتْهُمُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ وَذَكَرَهُمُ اللَّهُ فِيمَنْ عِنْدَهُ وَمَنْ بَطَّأَ بِهِ عَمَلُهُ لَمْ يُسْرِعْ بِهِ نَسَبُهُ

Whoever sets out on a path to seek knowledge, Allah will make easy for him the path to Paradise. When a group of people gather in one of Allah’s houses to recite His Book and study it together, tranquility descends upon them, mercy covers them, the angels surround them, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him (the angels). And the deeds of a person will not benefit him if they are deficient, even if he is of noble lineage.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2699 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6608 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Here, seeking knowledge specifically means acquiring religious knowledge—the knowledge that enables a person to recognize Allah and follow His commandments. This hadith is not meant to elevate secular or purely worldly knowledge. Using this hadith to justify secular or non-religious education is a misapplication and incorrect interpretation.

Narrated Abu Huraira, The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

سَبْعَةٌ يُظِلُّهُمُ اللَّهُ فِي ظِلِّهِ يَوْمَ لاَ ظِلَّ إِلاَّ ظِلُّهُ الإِمَامُ الْعَادِلُ وَشَابٌّ نَشَأَ فِي عِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ وَرَجُلٌ قَلْبُهُ مُعَلَّقٌ فِي الْمَسَاجِدِ وَرَجُلاَنِ تَحَابَّا فِي اللهِ اجْتَمَعَا عَلَيْهِ وَتَفَرَّقَا عَلَيْهِ وَرَجُلٌ طَلَبَتْهُ امْرَأَةٌ ذَاتُ مَنْصِبٍ وَجَمَالٍ فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَخَافُ اللَّهَ وَرَجُلٌ تَصَدَّقَ أَخْفَى حَتَّى لاَ تَعْلَمَ شِمَالُهُ مَا تُنْفِقُ يَمِينُهُ وَرَجُلٌ ذَكَرَ اللَّهَ خَالِيًا فَفَاضَتْ عَيْنَاهُ.

Allah will give shade to seven, on the Day when there will be no shade but His. (These seven persons are) a just ruler, a youth who has been brought up in the worship of Allah (i.e. worships Allah sincerely from childhood), a man whose heart is attached to the mosques (i.e. to pray the compulsory prayers in the mosque in congregation), two persons who love each other only for Allah's sake and they meet and part in Allah's cause only, a man who refuses the call of a charming woman of noble birth for illicit intercourse with her and says: I am afraid of Allah, a man who gives charitable gifts so secretly that his left hand does not know what his right hand has given (i.e. nobody knows how much he has given in charity), and a person who remembers Allah in seclusion and his eyes are then flooded with tears.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 660 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 627 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Huraira, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

الْمَلاَئِكَةُ تُصَلِّي عَلَى أَحَدِكُمْ مَا دَامَ فِي مُصَلاَّهُ مَا لَمْ يُحْدِثْ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ اللَّهُمَّ ارْحَمْهُ.

The angels keep on asking for Allah's Blessing and Forgiveness for any of you as long as he is at his Musalla (praying place) and does not do Hadath (passes wind). The angels say, 'O Allah! Forgive him and be Merciful to him.' Each one of you is in the prayer as long as he is waiting for the prayer, and nothing but the prayer detains him from going to his family.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 659 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 626 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira (Allah be pleased with him) reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

إِذَا مَاتَ الإِنْسَانُ انْقَطَعَ عَنْهُ عَمَلُهُ إِلاَّ مِنْ ثَلاَثَةٍ إِلاَّ مِنْ صَدَقَةٍ جَارِيَةٍ أَوْ عِلْمٍ يُنْتَفَعُ بِهِ أَوْ وَلَدٍ صَالِحٍ يَدْعُو لَهُ

When a man dies, his acts come to an end, but three, recurring charity, or knowledge (by which people) benefit, or a pious son, who prays for him (for the deceased).

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1631 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 4077 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Sadaqah Jariyah refers to charity given in such a way that its benefits never come to an end. For example, if someone builds a mosque, then even after their death, as long as the mosque remains in use, the reward for it will continue to be added to their record of deeds.

Narrated Jabir bin `Abdullah, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

رَحِمَ اللَّهُ رَجُلاً سَمْحًا إِذَا بَاعَ ، وَإِذَا اشْتَرَى ، وَإِذَا اقْتَضَى

May Allah's mercy be on him who is lenient in his buying, selling, and in demanding back his money.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2076 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1946 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَيْنَمَا رَجُلٌ يَمْشِي بِطَرِيقٍ وَجَدَ غُصْنَ شَوْكٍ فَأَخَذَهُ فَشَكَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ فَغَفَرَ لَهُ.

While a man was on the way, he found a thorny branch of a tree there on the way and removed it. Allah thanked him for that deed and forgave him.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2472 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2310 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Huraira, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ تَصَدَّقَ بِعَدْلِ تَمْرَةٍ مِنْ كَسْبٍ طَيِّبٍ ، وَلاَ يَقْبَلُ اللَّهُ إِلاَّ الطَّيِّبَ - وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يَتَقَبَّلُهَا بِيَمِينِهِ ثُمَّ يُرَبِّيهَا لِصَاحِبِهِ كَمَا يُرَبِّي أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْوَهُ حَتَّى تَكُونَ مِثْلَ الْجَبَلِ.

If one give in charity what equals one date-fruit from the honestly earned money and Allah accepts only the honestly earned money --Allah takes it in His right (hand) and then enlarges its reward for that person (who has given it), as anyone of you brings up his baby horse, so much s that it becomes as big as a mountain.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1410 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1327 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abū Hurayrah (RA) reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَذِبًا أَنْ يُحَدِّثَ بِكُلِّ مَا سَمِعَ

It is enough of a lie for a person that he relates everything he hears.

Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Hadith 5 (authenticated by Fu’ād ‘Abdul Bāqī), Introduction section (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Abu Mas'ud reported Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) as saying,

إِنَّ الْمُسْلِمَ إِذَا أَنْفَقَ عَلَى أَهْلِهِ نَفَقَةً وَهُوَ يَحْتَسِبُهَا كَانَتْ لَهُ صَدَقَةً

When a Muslim spends on his family seeking reward for it from Allah, it counts for him as sadaqa.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1002 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2191 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated `Aisha (RA),

سُئِلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أَيُّ الأَعْمَالِ أَحَبُّ إِلَى اللهِ قَالَ أَدْوَمُهَا وَإِنْ قَلَّ وَقَالَ اكْلَفُوا مِنَ الأَعْمَالِ مَا تُطِيقُون.

The Prophet (ﷺ) was asked, "What deeds are loved most by Allah?" He said, "The most regular constant deeds, even though they may be few." He added, 'Don't take upon yourselves, except the deeds which are within your ability."

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6465 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6021 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

‘Abdullāh ibn ‘Amr (RA) reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said

لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنَّانٌ وَلَا عَاقٌّ وَلَا مُدْمِنُ خَمْرٍ

One who does a favor and then reminds others of it (reproachfully), one who is disobedient to his parents, and one who habitually drinks alcohol — these will not enter Paradise.

Sunan an-Nasā’ī, Hadith 5672 (Authenticated by ‘Abdul Fattāh Abū Ghuddah), 5675 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Ibn `Abbas (RA),

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْمُتَشَبِّهِينَ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ بِالنِّسَاءِ وَالْمُتَشَبِّهَاتِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ بِالرِّجَالِ.

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cursed those men who are in the similitude (assume the manners) of women and those women who are in the similitude (assume the manners) of men.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5885 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5465 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Ibn `Umar said, The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

خَالِفُوا الْمُشْرِكِينَ وَفِّرُوا اللِّحَى وَأَحْفُوا الشَّوَارِبَ ، وَكَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ إِذَا حَجَّ ، أَوِ اعْتَمَرَ قَبَضَ عَلَى لِحْيَتِهِ فَمَا فَضَلَ أَخَذَهُ.

'Do the opposite of what the pagans do. Keep the beards and cut the moustaches short.' Whenever Ibn `Umar performed the Hajj or `Umra, he used to hold his beard with his hand and cut whatever remained outside his hold.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5892 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5472 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
Growing the beard is not an optional or merely recommended Sunnah; it is wājib (obligatory). Trimming it to less than a fist’s length or shaving it entirely are both sinful acts. Moreover, this sin continues every moment one remains in that state. It is often heard from some people: “Keeping a beard is Sunnah, so there’s no problem if one doesn’t keep it.” This statement is incorrect.

Narrated ʿĀ’ishah (RA), The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ أَحْدَثَ فِي أَمْرِنَا هَذَا مَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ فَهُوَ رَدٌّ.

Whoever introduces into this matter of ours (Islam) something that is not part of it, it will be rejected.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2697 (Fu’ād ʿAbdul Bāqī verification), 2517 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
Anything newly added to the religion in the name of Islam, which has no basis in the Shariah, is called bid‘ah (innovation). Such innovations are to be rejected. No matter how beautiful or appealing they seem, they are not permissible to act upon — for example, holding a chillishā (fortieth-day ritual) after someone’s death.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ سَرَّهُ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ ، وَأَنْ يُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ.

Whoever is pleased that he be granted more wealth and that his lease of life be prolonged, then he should keep good relations with his Kith and kin.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5985 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5559 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Jubair bin Mut`im, that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying,

لاَ يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ قَاطِعٌ.

The person who severs the bond of kinship will not enter Paradise.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5984 (authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5558 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Narrated Abu Huraira (RA),

قَبَّلَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ وَعِنْدَهُ الأَقْرَعُ بْنُ حَابِسٍ التَّمِيمِيُّ جَالِسًا فَقَالَ الأَقْرَعُ إِنَّ لِي عَشَرَةً مِنَ الْوَلَدِ مَا قَبَّلْتُ مِنْهُمْ أَحَدًا فَنَظَرَ إِلَيْهِ رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم ثُمَّ قَالَ مَنْ لاَ يَرْحَمُ لاَ يُرْحَمُ.

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) kissed Al-Hasan bin `Ali while Al-Aqra' bin H`Abis at-Tamim was sitting beside him. Al-Aqra said, "I have ten children and I have never kissed anyone of them." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) cast a look at him and said, "Whoever is not merciful to others will not be treated mercifully."

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5997 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5571 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated `Aisha (the wife of the Prophet),

جَاءَتْنِي امْرَأَةٌ مَعَهَا ابْنَتَانِ تَسْأَلُنِي فَلَمْ تَجِدْ عِنْدِي غَيْرَ تَمْرَةٍ وَاحِدَةٍ فَأَعْطَيْتُهَا فَقَسَمَتْهَا بَيْنَ ابْنَتَيْهَا ثُمَّ قَامَتْ فَخَرَجَتْ فَدَخَلَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَحَدَّثْتُهُ فَقَالَ مَنْ يَلِي مِنْ هَذِهِ الْبَنَاتِ شَيْئًا فَأَحْسَنَ إِلَيْهِنَّ كُنَّ لَهُ سِتْرًا مِنَ النَّارِ.

A lady, along with her two daughters, came to me asking me (for some alms), but she found nothing with me except one date, which I gave to he,r and she divided it between her two daughters, and then she got up and went away. Then the Prophet (ﷺ) came in and I informed him about this story. He said, "Whoever is in charge of (put to the test by) these daughters and treats them generously, then they will act as a shield for him from the (Hell) Fire."

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5995 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5569 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Ibn ʿAbbās (RA) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

مَا مِنْ رَجُلٍ تُدْرِكُ لَهُ ابْنَتَانِ ، فَيُحْسِنُ إِلَيْهِمَا مَا صَحِبَتَاهُ ، أَوْ صَحِبَهُمَا ، إِلاَّ أَدْخَلَتَاهُ الْجَنَّةَ.

Whoever has two daughters, and as long as they live together, he treats them well, they will cause him to enter Paradise.

Sunan Ibn Mājah 3670

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

إِذَا انْتَعَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْيُمْنَى وَإِذَا خَلَعَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالشِّمَالِ وَلْيُنْعِلْهُمَا جَمِيعًا أَوْ لِيَخْلَعْهُمَا جَمِيعًا

When one of you puts on sandals, he should first put in the right foot, and when he takes them off, he should take off the left one first. And he should wear both of them or take both off.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2097 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5318 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

One should not wear a shoe on one foot while leaving the other foot bare. This hadith prohibits such an act. If shoes are to be worn, they must be worn on both feet; otherwise, one should walk barefoot. This is the teaching of the hadith.

Jabir (RA) reported,

أُتِىَ بِأَبِى قُحَافَةَ يَوْمَ فَتْحِ مَكَّةَ وَرَأْسُهُ وَلِحْيَتُهُ كَالثَّغَامَةِ بَيَاضًا فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « غَيِّرُوا هَذَا بِشَىْءٍ وَاجْتَنِبُوا السَّوَادَ »

When Abu Qubafa (father of Abu Bakr) came in the year of Victory or on the Day of Victory (to the Prophet to pledge his allegiance to him), his head and his beard were white like hyssop. He (the Holy Prophet) commaded or the women were commanded by him that they should change this with something (that the colour of his hair should be changed).

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2102 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5331 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

If someone’s hair or beard turns grey, they may use dye of any color except black. Using black dye is a sinful act. However, if someone’s hair turns grey at a young age due to illness, then they are allowed to use black dye as well. It should be noted that the black hair dyes available in the market are generally not healthy and are more likely to cause harm.

Narrated Abu Talha, I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying,

لاَ تَدْخُلُ الْمَلاَئِكَةُ بَيْتًا فِيهِ كَلْبٌ ، وَلاَ صُورَةُ تَمَاثِيلَ.

Angels (of Mercy) do not enter a house wherein there is a dog or a picture of a living creature (a human being or an animal).

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 3225 (authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 2998 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Jabir (RA) reported,

نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- عَنِ الضَّرْبِ فِى الْوَجْهِ وَعَنِ الْوَسْمِ فِى الْوَجْهِ

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade (the animals to be beaten) on the face or cauterisation on the face.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2116 (authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5368 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri reported Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) as saying,

« إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْجُلُوسَ فِى الطُّرُقَاتِ ». قَالُوا يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا لَنَا بُدٌّ مِنْ مَجَالِسِنَا نَتَحَدَّثُ فِيهَا. قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « فَإِذَا أَبَيْتُمْ إِلاَّ الْمَجْلِسَ فَأَعْطُوا الطَّرِيقَ حَقَّهُ ». قَالُوا وَمَا حَقُّهُ قَالَ « غَضُّ الْبَصَرِ وَكَفُّ الأَذَى وَرَدُّ السَّلاَمِ وَالأَمْرُ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَالنَّهْىُ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ »

Avoid sitting on the paths. They (his Companions) said: Allah's Messenger, there is no other help to it (but to sit there as we) hold our meetings and discuss matters there. Thereupon Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: If you have to sit at all, then fulfil the rights of the path. They said: What are their rights? Thereupon he said: Keeping the eye downward (so that you may not stare at the women), refraining from doing some harm to the other and exchanging mutual greetings (saying as-Salamu 'Alaikum to one another) and commanding the good and forbidding the evil.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2121 (Authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5380 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh).

Narrated from Ibn ʿUmar (RA),

عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى الله عَليْهِ وسَلَّمَ ، أَنَّهُ لَعَنَ الْوَاصِلَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْصِلَةَ ، وَالْوَاشِمَةَ ، وَالْمُسْتَوْشِمَةَ.

The Prophet ﷺ cursed the woman who adds artificial hair and the one who has it added, and the one who tattoos parts of the body and the one who has it done.

Sunan Ibn Mājah 1987 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Huraira, The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

إِذَا أَتَى أَحَدَكُمْ خَادِمُهُ بِطَعَامِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يُجْلِسْهُ مَعَهُ فَلْيُنَاوِلْهُ لُقْمَةً ، أَوْ لُقْمَتَيْنِ ، أَوْ أُكْلَةً ، أَوْ أُكْلَتَيْنِ فَإِنَّهُ وَلِيَ عِلاَجَهُ.

When your servant brings your meals to you, if he does not let him sit and share the meals, then he should at least give him a mouthful or two of that meal, or a meal or two meals, as he has prepared them.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2557 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5065 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

طَعَامُ الاِثْنَيْنِ كَافِي الثَّلاَثَةِ وَطَعَامُ الثَّلاَثَةِ كَافِي الأَرْبَعَةِ.

The food for two persons is sufficient for three, and the food for three persons is enough for four persons.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 5392 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5000 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Nafi` (RA),

كَانَ ابْنُ عُمَرَ لاَ يَأْكُلُ حَتَّى يُؤْتَى بِمِسْكِينٍ يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَدْخَلْتُ رَجُلاً يَأْكُلُ مَعَهُ فَأَكَلَ كَثِيرًا فَقَالَ يَا نَافِعُ لاَ تُدْخِلْ هَذَا عَلَيَّ سَمِعْتُ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَقُولُ الْمُؤْمِنُ يَأْكُلُ فِي مِعًى وَاحِدٍ وَالْكَافِرُ يَأْكُلُ فِي سَبْعَةِ أَمْعَاءٍ.

Ibn `Umar never used to take his meal unless a poor man was called to eat with him. One day I brought a poor man to eat with him, the man ate too much, whereupon Ibn `Umar said, "O Nafi`! Don't let this man enter my house, for I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "A believer eats in one intestine (is satisfied with a little food), and a kafir (unbeliever) eats in seven intestines (eats much food).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5393 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5001 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Juhaifa, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

لاَ آكُلُ مُتَّكِئًا.

I do not take my meals while leaning (against something).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5398 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5006 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

It is Sunnah not to lean while eating or drinking. For a healthy person who can sit normally, eating or drinking while leaning or resting against something is disliked. In another hadith, ʿAbdullāh ibn ʿAmr (RA) narrates from his father that the Noble Prophet ﷺ was never seen eating while leaning in a normal state. (Sunan Abū Dāwūd 4/287) In another hadith, the Noble Prophet ﷺ said: “I am the servant of Allah. I eat as a servant eats, and I sit for eating as a servant sits.” (Kitāb al-Zuhd, p. 11) However, due to illness or weakness, there is allowance for eating or drinking while leaning. This is because it is proven by hadith that the Noble Prophet ﷺ, in a state of hunger and weakness, ate while leaning. Anas (RA) narrates: Dates were presented before the Noble Prophet ﷺ, and I saw him eating them while leaning because of weakness from hunger.

Narrated `Aisha (RA):

كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يُحِبُّ التَّيَمُّنَ مَا اسْتَطَاعَ فِي طُهُورِهِ وَتَنَعُّلِهِ وَتَرَجُّلِهِ ،

The Prophet (ﷺ) used to love to start doing things from the right side whenever possible, in performing ablution, putting on his shoes, and combing his hair. (Al-Ash'ath said: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to do so in all his affairs.)

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5380 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 4988 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated `Umar bin Abi Salama (RA),

كُنْتُ غُلاَمًا فِي حَجْرِ رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَكَانَتْ يَدِي تَطِيشُ فِي الصَّحْفَةِ فَقَال لِي رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَا غُلاَمُ سَمِّ اللَّهَ وَكُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ وَكُلْ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ طِعْمَتِي بَعْدُ.

I was a boy under the care of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and my hand used to go around the dish while I was eating. So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me, 'O boy! Mention the Name of Allah and eat with your right hand, and eat of the dish what is nearer to you." Since then, I have applied those instructions when eating.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5376 (Verified by Fu’ād Abdul-Bāqī), 4984 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn Mas‘ud (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

‏لا حسد إلا في اثنتين‏:‏ رجل آتاه الله مالا فسلطه على هلكته في الحق، ورجل آتاه الله الحكمة فهو يقضي بها ويعلمها‏

There is no envy except in two cases:

A man whom Allah has given wealth and He enables him to spend it in the right way;

and a man whom Allah has given wisdom, and he judges in accordance with it and teaches it to others.

— Riyad as-Salihin, Hadith 1377

Narrated by al-Mughirah al-Muzani (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

‏إنه ليغان على قلبي، وإني لأستغفر الله في اليوم مائة مرة‏

Indeed, I feel a covering over my heart, and I seek Allah’s forgiveness one hundred times a day

— Riyad as-Salihin, Hadith 1869

Footnote:

Here, the word “ghayn” (ليُغانُ) does not refer to sin. Rather, it means that worldly thoughts or concerns may momentarily distract the Prophet’s heart from complete remembrance of Allah. According to his elevated standard of spiritual purification, such distraction is considered a “covering,” and so he would regularly make istighfar (seeking forgiveness).

Narrated by Ibn ‘Abbas (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

من لزم الاستغفار ، جعل الله له من كل ضيق مخرجاً ومن كل هم فرجاً، ورزقه من حيث لا يحتسب‏‏

Whoever persists in seeking forgiveness, Allah will make for him a way out from every difficulty, relief from every worry, and will provide for him from sources he could never imagine

— Riyad as-Salihin, Hadith 1873; reported by Abu Dawud

Narrated by Jabir (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

يأكل أهل الجنة فيها ، ويشربون ، ولا يتغوطون، ولا يتمخطون، ولا يبولون، ولكن طعامهم ذلك جشاء كرشح المسك، يلهمون التسبيح والتكبير، كما يلهمون النفس‏.

The people of Paradise will eat and drink therein, but they will not defecate, blow their noses, or urinate. Rather, their food will be digested in the form of belching with a fragrance like musk. They will be inspired to glorify Allah (Tasbih) and proclaim His greatness (Takbir) as naturally as they breathe.

— Sahih Muslim, Hadith No. 2835

Narrated by Abu Hurairah (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

‏إِذَا شَرِبَ الْكَلْبُ فِي إِنَاءِ أَحَدِكُمْ فَلْيَغْسِلْهُ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ

If a dog drinks from the vessel of any one of you, let him wash it seven times.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith No. 408

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-As (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ هُدِيَ إِلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَرُزِقَ الْكَفَافَ وَقَنِعَ بِهِ ‏

Successful is the one who is guided to Islam, is provided with what is sufficient, and is content with it.

Muslim 1054, Tirmidhi 2348

Narrated Abdullah ibn Mas‘ud (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنْ كَانَ فِي قَلْبِهِ مِثْقَالُ ذَرَّةٍ مِنْ كِبْرٍ

He who has in his heart the weight of a mustard seed of pride shall not enter Paradise.

— Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi 1922; Hasan Sahih

Hazrat Abu Umamah al-Bara’ ibn ‘Azib (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us to do seven things:

بِعِيَادَةِ المَرِيضِ، وَاتِّبَاعِ الجَنَائِزِ، وَتَشْمِيتِ العَاطِسِ، وَنَصْرِ الضَّعيفِ، وَعَوْنِ المَظْلُومِ، وَإفْشَاءِ السَّلاَمِ، وَإبْرَارِ المُقسِمِ.

To visit the sick, to follow funeral processions, to respond to the one who sneezes, to support the weak, to help the oppressed, to spread the greeting of peace (Salam), and to assist in fulfilling the oath of the one who swears an oath.

Sahih al-Bukhari: 2445; Sahih Muslim: 2066

Hazrat Abu Hurayrah (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

لاَ تَدْخُلُوا الجَنَّةَ حَتَّى تُؤمِنُوا، وَلاَ تُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا، أوَلاَ أدُلُّكُمْ عَلَى شَيْءٍ إِذَا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحَابَبْتُمْ؟ أفْشُوا السَّلاَمَ بَيْنَكُمْ

You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I tell you something which, if you do it, you will love one another? Spread the greeting of peace (Salam) among yourselves.

Sahih Muslim: 54; Sunan Abu Dawood: 5193; Jami’ at-Tirmidhi

Hazrat Jabir (RA) said:

كَانَ لَا يَنَامُ حَتَّى يَقْرَأَ: (آلم تَنْزِيل) و (تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ)

The Noble Prophet (ﷺ) would not go to sleep until he recited Surah Alif–Lam–Meem Tanzil (Surah As-Sajdah) and Surah Tabaarakalladhi Biyadihi al-Mulk (Surah Al-Mulk).

Mishkat: 2155. Ahmad, Tirmidhi, and Darimi have narrated this Hadith. Tirmidhi said: “This Hadith is Sahih.”

Hazrat Aishah (RA) said: The Noble Prophet (ﷺ) said:

قِرَاءَةُ الْقُرْآنِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ فِي غَيْرِ الصَّلَاةِ وَقِرَاءَةُ الْقُرْآنِ فِي غَيْرِ الصَّلَاةِ أَفْضَلُ مِنَ التَّسْبِيحِ وَالتَّكْبِيرِ وَالتَّسْبِيحُ أَفْضَلُ مِنَ الصَّدَقَةِ وَالصَّدَقَةُ أَفْضَلُ مِنَ الصَّوْمِ وَالصَّوْمُ جُنَّةٌ مِنَ النَّارِ

Reciting the Qur’an in prayer is better than reciting the Qur’an outside of prayer; reciting the Qur’an outside of prayer is better than uttering tasbih (glorification) and takbir (proclaiming Allah’s greatness); uttering tasbih and takbir is better than giving charity; giving charity is better than (voluntary) fasting; and fasting is a shield from the Fire (of Hell)

(Mishkat: 2166)

Hazrat Ibn ‘Umar (RA) narrated that the Noble Prophet (ﷺ) said:

إِنَّمَا مَثَلُ صَاحِبِ الْقُرْآنِ كَمَثَلِ صَاحِبِ الْإِبِلِ الْمُعَقَّلَةِ إِنْ عَاهَدَ عَلَيْهَا أَمْسَكَهَا وَإِنْ أَطْلَقَهَا ذَهَبَتْ

The example of the one who has memorized the Qur’an is like the owner of a camel that is tied with a rope—if he takes care to watch over it, he will keep hold of it; but if he lets it loose, it will run away.

(Mishkat: 2189)

Hazrat Jundub ibn Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said:

اقرؤوا الْقُرْآنَ مَا ائْتَلَفَتْ عَلَيْهِ قُلُوبُكُمْ فَإِذَا اخْتَلَفْتُمْ فَقومُوا عَنهُ

Read the Quran as long as your hearts are in harmony with it. But when you find yourselves in disagreement (or disinterest), then rise and leave it

(Mishkat: 2190)

Humayd ibn Mas'ada (may Allah have mercy on him) narrated from Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said

خَمْسٌ مِنْ الْفِطْرَةِ الْخِتَانُ وَحَلْقُ الْعَانَةِ وَنَتْفُ الضَّبْعِ وَتَقْلِيمُ الظُّفْرِ وَتَقْصِيرُ الشَّارِبِ وَقَفَهُ مَالِكٌ

Five practices are part of the fitrah (natural disposition): circumcision, shaving the pubic hair, plucking the armpit hair, trimming the nails, and shortening the mustache

(Nasa'i: 5043)

Imran ibn Yazid (Rah.) narrated from Abdullah ibn Umar (R.A.) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

نَهَانِي اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ عَنْ الْقَزَعِ

Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, has forbidden me from Qaza' (i.e., shaving some parts of the head and leaving others

Nasa'i: 5050

Muhammad ibn Salamah (may Allah have mercy on him) narrated from Ruwayfi' ibn Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

يَا رُوَيْفِعُ لَعَلَّ الْحَيَاةَ سَتَطُولُ بِكَ بَعْدِي فَأَخْبِرْ النَّاسَ أَنَّهُ مَنْ عَقَدَ لِحْيَتَهُ أَوْ تَقَلَّدَ وَتَرًا أَوْ اسْتَنْجَى بِرَجِيعِ دَابَّةٍ أَوْ عَظْمٍ فَإِنَّ مُحَمَّدًا بَرِيءٌ مِنْهُ

O Ruwayfi', perhaps life will be prolonged for you after me. So inform the people that whoever ties his beard, or ties a bowstring around his neck, or cleans himself after relieving himself with the dung of an animal or a bone, then indeed Muhammad is free from him.

Sunan an-Nasa'i, Hadith 5068.

Muhammad ibn Muslim (may Allah have mercy on him) narrated from Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

أَفْضَلُ مَا غَيَّرْتُمْ بِهِ الشَّمَطَ الْحِنَّاءُ وَالْكَتَمُ

The best things with which you can change the whiteness of old age are henna and katam (a type of plant)

Sunan an-Nasa'i: 5077

Rabee ibn Sulayman (may Allah have mercy on him) narrated from Abu Salamah (may Allah be pleased with him) that:

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ كَانَ يَلْبَسُ خَاتَمَهُ فِي يَمِينِهِ

The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to wear his ring on his right hand.

Sunan an-Nasa'i: 5203

Narrated by Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me:

إِذَا أتَيْتَ مَضْجَعَكَ فَتَوَضَّأ وُضُوءكَ لِلْصَّلاَةِ، ثُمَّ اضْطَجِعْ عَلَى شِقِّكَ الأَيْمَن، وَقُلْ ... » وذَكَرَ نَحْوَهُ، وفيه: «وَاجْعَلْهُنَّ آخِرَ مَا تَقُولُ

When you go to your bed, perform ablution as you do for prayer, then lie down on your right side and say..." (and he mentioned the supplication, similar to it), and in it.And make these (words) the last of what you say.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith No. 6313; Sahih Muslim, Hadith No. 2710

Footnote:

This Hadith teaches us the etiquette and manners of sleeping. It mentions three etiquettes of sleep:

  1. Sleeping with ablution (wudu).

  2. Sleeping on the right side.

  3. Reciting the supplication before sleeping.

Ummul Mu’minin Hazrat Aisha (RA) said:

كَانَ النبيُّ – صلى الله عليه وسلم – يُصَلِّي مِنَ اللَّيْلِ إحْدَى عَشرَةَ رَكْعَةً، فَإذا طَلَعَ الفَجْرُ صَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ خَفِيفَتَيْنِ، ثُمَّ اضْطَجَعَ عَلَى شِقِّهِ الأَيْمَن حَتَّى يَجيءَ الْمُؤَذِّنُ فَيُؤْذِنَهُ.

The Prophet (ﷺ) used to pray eleven Rak'at at night, and when dawn appeared, he would pray two Rak'at lightly. Then he would lie down on his right side until the Mu'adhdhin (caller to prayer) came to inform him (for the congregational prayer)

Sahih al-Bukhari: 626 Sahih Muslim: 736 Sunan Abu Dawood: 1336

Footnote:

This Hadith mentions three things: the number of Rak'at in the Tahajjud prayer of the Prophet (ﷺ), how he performed the two Rak'at of Fajr, and his resting after the Sunnah prayer before performing the obligatory prayer.

Hazrat Huzaifah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported:

كَانَ النَّبيُّ – صلى الله عليه وسلم – إِذَا أخَذَ مَضْجَعَهُ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ وَضَعَ يَدَهُ تَحْتَ خَدِّهِ، ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: «اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْمِكَ أمُوتُ وَأحْيَا» وَإِذَا اسْتَيْقَظ قَالَ: «الْحَمْدُ للهِ الَّذِي أحْيَانَا بَعْدَمَا أمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُشُورُ».

When the Prophet (peace be upon him) would lie down to sleep at night, he would place his hand under his cheek and then say:

'اللَّهُمَّ بِاسْمِكَ أَمُوتُ وَأَحْيَا'

‘O Allah, in Your name I die and I live.’

And when he would wake up, he would say:

'الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَحْيَانَا بَعْدَمَا أَمَاتَنَا وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ'

‘All praise is due to Allah, who has given us life after causing us to die, and to Him is the resurrection.’

Sahih Bukhari: 6314; Jami Tirmidhi: 3417

Footnote:

This Hadith teaches us the etiquette of sleep, which includes placing the right hand under the right cheek while lying down. Additionally, the Prophet (peace be upon him) would recite this supplication before sleeping.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet ﷺ said:

وَالكَلِمَةُ الطَّيِّبَةُ صَدَقَةٌ

A good word is a charity.

Sahih al-Bukhari: 2707; Sahih Muslim: 1009; Musnad Ahmad: 8183; al-Bayhaqi: 7820; al-Baghawi, Sharh al-Sunnah: 1645

Footnote:

A good word is also a form of charity. That is, just as giving charity brings reward, speaking good words also brings reward.

ʿUmar (RA) said: “Righteousness is an easy matter—[it is] a cheerful face and gentle speech.”

When a Companion named Abu Shurayh (RA) asked the Prophet ﷺ about the means to attain Paradise, he ﷺ replied:

طِيبُ الْكَلَامِ، وَبَذْلُ السَّلَامِ، وَإِطْعَامُ الطَّعَامِ

Speaking good words, spreading the greeting of peace, and feeding people.

Sahih Ibn Hibban: 504; al-Tabarani, al-Muʿjam al-Kabir: 470; al-Adab al-Mufrad: 811

Abu Dharr (RA) said: Once the Noble Prophet ﷺ said to me:

لاَ تَحْقِرَنَّ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ شَيْئًا، وَلَوْ أَنْ تَلْقَى أخَاكَ بوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ

Do not belittle any good deed, even if it is meeting your brother with a cheerful face.

Sahih Muslim: 2626; al-Baghawi, Sharh al-Sunnah: 1689; al-Tabarani, al-Muʿjam al-Kabir: 6385; Musnad Ahmad: 1471

Footnote:

In this hadith, the Prophet ﷺ strictly forbids regarding any righteous act as insignificant. This is because no one knows when and which deed will be accepted by Allah. It may be that a seemingly small act is so accepted by Allah that it transforms a person’s life in this world and becomes a means of salvation in the Hereafter. From this Hadith, we also learn that smiling when you speak to your fellow Muslim is a form of good deeds.

Abu Dharr (RA) said: Once the Noble Prophet ﷺ said to me:

لاَ تَحْقِرَنَّ مِنَ الْمَعْرُوفِ شَيْئًا، وَلَوْ أَنْ تَلْقَى أخَاكَ بوَجْهٍ طَلْقٍ

Do not belittle any good deed, even if it is meeting your brother with a cheerful face.

Sahih Muslim: 2626; al-Baghawi, Sharh al-Sunnah: 1689; al-Tabarani, al-Muʿjam al-Kabir: 6385; Musnad Ahmad: 1471

Footnote:

In this hadith, the Prophet ﷺ strictly forbids regarding any righteous act as insignificant. This is because no one knows when and which deed will be accepted by Allah. It may be that a seemingly small act is so accepted by Allah that it transforms a person’s life in this world and becomes a means of salvation in the Hereafter.

Jabir ibn Samurah (RA) said:

كَانَ النبيُّ – صلى الله عليه وسلم – إِذَا صَلَّى الفَجْرَ تَرَبَّعَ في مَجْلِسِهِ حَتَّى تَطْلُعَ الشَّمْسُ حَسْنَاءَ

When the Prophet ﷺ performed the Fajr prayer, he would remain seated in his place until the sun had risen brightly.

Sunan Abi Dawud: 4850; al-Baghawi, Sharh al-Sunnah: 3358

Footnote:

In this hadith, Jabir ibn Samurah (RA) describes a practice of the Prophet ﷺ: after performing the Fajr prayer, he would remain seated in his prayer place until the sun had risen well. The Prophet ﷺ would regularly perform this deed, engaging in the remembrance of Allah during that time. It was one of his beloved acts of worship.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

إِذَا انْتَهى أَحَدُكُمْ إِلَى المَجْلِسِ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ، فَإذَا أَرَادَ أَنْ يَقُومَ فَلْيُسَلِّمْ

When one of you arrives at a gathering, let him greet [with Salam]. Then when he wishes to leave, let him also greet [with Salam]

Sunan Abi Dawud: 5208; Jamiʿ al-Tirmidhi: 2707; al-Nasa’i, al-Sunan al-Kubra: 10129

Lessons from the Hadith:

1-By offering Salam, the one greeting assures others that no harm or evil will come from him. Therefore, the one offering Salam should be mindful of this inherent message.

2-Just as Salam is given upon arriving at a gathering or meeting someone, it should likewise be given when departing.

Narrated by al-Bara’ ibn ʿAzib (RA), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

مَا مِنْ مُسْلِمَينِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ فَيَتَصَافَحَانِ إِلاَّ غُفِرَ لَهُمَا قَبْلَ أَنْ يَفْتَرِقَا

Whenever two Muslims meet and shake hands, their sins are forgiven before they part.

Sunan Abi Dawud: 5211; Jamiʿ al-Tirmidhi: 2727

Footnote:

This hadith highlights the virtue of shaking hands (Musafahah). Through it, not only is mutual love expressed, but sins are also erased. In another hadith, the Prophet ﷺ said:

إن المؤمن إذا صافح أخاه تحات خطاياهما كما تتحات ورق الشجر

"When a believer shakes hands with his brother, their sins fall away just as the leaves of a tree fall."

(Musnad al-Bazzar: 8335)

Narrated by Samurah (RA), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

الْبَسُوا البَيَاضَ؛ فَإنَّهَا أَطْهَرُ وَأَطْيَبُ، وَكَفِّنُوا فِيهَا مَوْتَاكُمْ

Wear white garments, for they are the purest and best. And shroud your dead in them.

Sunan al-Nasa’i: 1896; Jamiʿ al-Tirmidhi: 2810

Abu Hurayrah (RA) reported:

يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم، مَنْ أَبَرُّ‏؟‏ قَالَ‏:‏ أُمَّكَ، قَالَ‏:‏ ثُمَّ مَنْ‏؟‏ قَالَ‏:‏ أُمَّكَ، قَالَ‏:‏ ثُمَّ مَنْ‏؟‏ قَالَ‏:‏ أُمَّكَ، قَالَ‏:‏ ثُمَّ مَنْ‏؟‏ قَالَ‏:‏ أَبَاكَ‏.‏

O Messenger of Allah, who is most deserving of my good companionship?"

He replied: "Your mother."

The man asked, "Then who?"

He replied: "Your mother."

The man asked again, "Then who?"

He replied: "Your mother."

The man asked once more, "Then who?"

He replied: "Your father."

Sahih Muslim: 5048; Sahih al-Bukhari: 5971

Hazrat Abu Sa‘id al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Jibreel (peace be upon him) came to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and said,

يَا مُحَمَّدُ، اشْتَكَيْتَ؟ قَالَ: «نَعَمْ» قَالَ: بِسْمِ الله أرْقِيكَ، مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ يُؤْذِيكَ، مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ أَوْ عَيْنِ حَاسِدٍ، اللهُ يَشْفِيكَ، بِسمِ اللهِ أُرقِيكَ.

“O Muhammad, are you feeling unwell?”

He replied, “Yes.”

Jibreel said:

بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَرْقِيكَ، مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ يُؤْذِيكَ، مِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ نَفْسٍ، أَوْ عَيْنِ حَاسِدٍ، اللَّهُ يَشْفِيكَ، بِسْمِ اللَّهِ أَرْقِيكَ

“In the name of Allah, I perform ruqyah for you, from everything that harms you, from the evil of every soul, or the evil eye of an envier. May Allah cure you. In the name of Allah, I perform ruqyah for you.”

Sahih Muslim: 2186; Musannaf Ibn Abi Shaybah: 23573; Jami‘ Ma‘mar ibn Rashid: 19779

Hazrat Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

يقولُ اللهُ تَعَالَى: مَا لِعَبْدِي المُؤمِن عِنْدِي جَزَاءٌ إِذَا قَبَضْتُ صَفِيَّهُ مِنْ أهْل الدُّنْيَا، ثُمَّ احْتَسَبَهُ إِلاَّ الجَنَّةَ

Allah, the Exalted, says: “My believing servant has no reward with Me, when I take away his beloved one from among the people of the world and he patiently hopes for the reward, except Paradise.”

Sahih al-Bukhari: 6424; Al-Bayhaqi, Shu‘ab al-Iman: 9395

Hazrat Umayyah ibn Makhshi (رضي الله عنه) narrated:

كَانَ رسولُ الله – صلى الله عليه وسلم – جَالِسًا، وَرَجُلٌ يَأكُلُ، فَلَمْ يُسَمِّ اللهَ حَتَّى لَمْ يَبْقَ مِنْ طَعَامِهِ إِلاَّ لُقْمَةٌ، فَلَمَّا رَفَعَهَا إِلَى فِيهِ، قَالَ: بِسْمِ اللهِ أوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، فَضَحِكَ النَّبيّ – صلى الله عليه وسلم – ثُمَّ قَالَ: «مَا زَالَ الشَّيْطَانُ يَأكُلُ مَعَهُ، فَلَمَّا ذَكَرَ اسمَ اللهِ اسْتَقَاءَ مَا فِي بَطْنِهِ».

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was sitting while a man was eating. The man did not mention the name of Allah until there was only one morsel of food left. When he raised it to his mouth, he said, 'Bismillah awwalahu wa akhirahu' (In the name of Allah, at its beginning and its end). The Prophet (ﷺ) smiled and then said, 'Shaytan had been eating with him, but when he mentioned the name of Allah, Shaytan vomited what was in his stomach.

Sunan Abi Dawud: 3768; At-Tabarani, Al-Mu'jam Al-Kabir: 855; Al-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman: 5446; An-Nasa'i, As-Sunan Al-Kubra: 6725; Musnad Ahmad: 18963.

Hazrat Anas (رضي الله عنه) narrates:

رَأَيْتُ رسول الله – صلى الله عليه وسلم – جَالِسًا مُقْعِيًا يَأكُلُ تَمْرًا.

I saw the Messenger of Allah (صلى الله عليه وسلم) sitting in a muq'i position, eating dates.

Sahih Muslim: 2044

Footnote:

The word "al-muq'i" is derived from "iqā’". It refers to sitting in a position where the buttocks rest on the ground, the shins are upright, and the hands are wrapped around the shins. In Arabic, this is also called "iḥtibā’." Typically, slaves used to sit in this manner in that era. The Prophet (صلى الله عليه وسلم) also often sat in this way. Such a posture reflects humility, as it resembles the sitting style of slaves.

Lesson from the Hadith:

As servants of Allah (تعالى), we should adopt humility in all aspects, including the way we sit, just as we do in other areas of life.

Abu Tahir Ahmad ibn ‘Amr ibn Sarh and Harmalah ibn Yahya (may Allah have mercy on them) … narrated from ‘Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA) who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ يَنْهَاكُمْ أَنْ تَحْلِفُوا بِآبَائِكُمْ " . قَالَ عُمَرُ فَوَاللَّهِ مَا حَلَفْتُ بِهَا مُنْذُ سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم نَهَى عَنْهَا ذَاكِرًا وَلاَ آثِرًا .

Indeed, Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, forbids you from swearing by your forefathers.”

‘Umar (RA) said: “By Allah, since I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbidding it, I have never sworn by them — neither intentionally nor while quoting someone else.

Sahih Muslim: 4108

Abu Tahir Ahmad ibn ‘Amr ibn Sarh and Harmalah ibn Yahya (may Allah have mercy on them) … narrated from ‘Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA) who said:The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

سْتَفْتَى سَعْدُ بْنُ عُبَادَةَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فِي نَذْرٍ كَانَ عَلَى أُمِّهِ تُوُفِّيَتْ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَقْضِيَهُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم " فَاقْضِهِ عَنْهَا" .

Indeed, Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, forbids you from swearing by your forefathers.”

‘Umar (RA) said: “By Allah, since I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ forbidding it, I have never sworn by them — neither intentionally nor while quoting someone else.”

Sahih Muslim: 4108

Yahya ibn Ayyub, Qutaybah ibn Sa‘id, and ‘Ali ibn Hujr (may Allah have mercy on them) … narrated from Abu Hurayrah (RA) that:

أَنَّ رَجُلاً، قَالَ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِنَّ أَبِي مَاتَ وَتَرَكَ مَالاً وَلَمْ يُوصِ فَهَلْ يُكَفِّرُ عَنْهُ أَنْ أَتَصَدَّقَ عَنْهُ قَالَ " نَعَمْ " .

A man said to the Prophet ﷺ, “My father has died and left behind some wealth, but he did not make a will. Will it expiate for him if I give charity on his behalf?”He ﷺ replied, “Yes.”

Sahih Muslim, Hadith No. 4073

Zuhayr ibn Harb (may Allah have mercy on him) … narrated from ‘A’ishah (RA) that:

أَنَّ رَجُلاً، قَالَ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِنَّ أُمِّيَ افْتُلِتَتْ نَفْسُهَا وَإِنِّي أَظُنُّهَا لَوْ تَكَلَّمَتْ تَصَدَّقَتْ فَلِيَ أَجْرٌ أَنْ أَتَصَدَّقَ عَنْهَا قَالَ " نَعَمْ " .

A man said to the Prophet ﷺ, “My mother died suddenly, and I think that if she had been able to speak, she would have given charity. Will I have a reward if I give charity on her behalf?”

He ﷺ said, “Yes.”

Hadith No. 4074

Narrated from Zayd ibn Aslam (may Allah have mercy on him), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

يُسَلِّمُ الرَّاكِبُ عَلَى الْمَاشِي وَإِذَا سَلَّمَ مِنْ الْقَوْمِ وَاحِدٌ أَجْزَأَ عَنْهُمْ

The one riding should greet the one walking, and if one person from a group gives the greeting, it is sufficient on behalf of all of them.

Muwatta Imam Malik: 53

Footnote:

In general, giving the greeting (Salam) first is considered better — regardless of who initiates it or to whom it is given. However, for the sake of peace and order, certain guidelines have been prescribed. Observing these rules not only helps maintain order, but also nurtures respect for elders, compassion for others, humility, and other noble moral qualities.

Narrated from Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

مَنْ دَعَا إِلَى هُدَىً كَانَ لَهُ مِنَ الأَجْرِ مِثْلُ أجُورِ مَنْ تَبِعَه لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذلِكَ مِنْ أجُورِهمْ شَيئاً وَمَنْ دَعَا إِلَى ضَلاَلَةٍ كَانَ عَلَيهِ مِنَ الإثْمِ مِثْلُ آثَامِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذلِكَ مِنْ آثَامِهِمْ شَيئاً

Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward similar to the rewards of those who follow him, without that diminishing anything from their rewards. And whoever calls to misguidance will bear a burden of sin similar to the sins of those who follow him, without that diminishing anything from their sins.”

Sahih Muslim, 6980

Narrated from Abu al-Yaqdhan ‘Ammar ibn Yasir (RA), he said:I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say:

إنَّ طُولَ صَلاَةِ الرَّجُلِ، وَقِصَرَ خُطْبَتِهِ، مَئِنَّةٌ مِنْ فِقهِهِ فَأَطِيلُوا الصَّلاَةَ وَأقْصِرُوا الْخُطْبَةَ

Indeed, the lengthening of a man’s prayer and the shortening of his sermon are signs of his understanding of the religion. So lengthen the prayer and shorten the sermon.

Sahih Muslim, 2046

Narrated from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Affan (RA):He said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say:

يَقُولُ ‏ "‏ مَنْ بَنَى لِلَّهِ مَسْجِدًا بَنَى اللَّهُ لَهُ مِثْلَهُ فِي الْجَنَّةِ ‏"‏ ‏

Whoever builds a mosque for Allah, Allah will build for him something similar in Paradise.

Bukhari 450, Muslim 531-2, Tirmidhi 318, Ahmad 436, Darimi 1392

Narrated from Anas ibn Malik (RA): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said:

لاَ تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ حَتَّى يَتَبَاهَى النَّاسُ فِي الْمَسَاجِدِ

The Hour will not be established until people begin to boast about their mosques (in beauty and adornment.

Nasa’i 689, Abu Dawud 449, Ahmad 11971

Narrated from ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr (RA): He said, a man asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), "Which deed in Islam is the best?"
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

تُطْعِمُ الطَّعَامَ وَتَقْرَأُ السَّلَامَ عَلَى مَنْ عَرَفْتَ وَمَنْ لم تعرف

To feed others, and to greet with peace those you know and those you do not know.

Sahih al-Bukhari (12, 28); Sahih Muslim (39–63); Musnad Ahmad (6581); Sunan an-Nasa’i (5000)

Narrated `Abdullah bin `Amr:

قَالَ رَجُلٌ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أُجَاهِدُ‏.‏ قَالَ ‏"‏ لَكَ أَبَوَانِ ‏"‏‏.‏ قَالَ نَعَمْ‏.‏ قَالَ ‏"‏ فَفِيهِمَا فَجَاهِدْ.

A man said to the Prophet, "Shall I participate in Jihad?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Are your parents living?" The man said, "Yes." the Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do Jihad for their benefit.

Sahih al-Bukhari 5972

Narrated `Abdullah bin `Amr:

إِنَّ مِنْ أَكْبَرِ الْكَبَائِرِ أَنْ يَلْعَنَ الرَّجُلُ وَالِدَيْهِ ‏"‏‏.‏ قِيلَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ وَكَيْفَ يَلْعَنُ الرَّجُلُ وَالِدَيْهِ قَالَ ‏"‏ يَسُبُّ الرَّجُلُ أَبَا الرَّجُلِ، فَيَسُبُّ أَبَاهُ، وَيَسُبُّ أَمَّهُ

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said. "It is one of the greatest sins that a man should curse his parents." It was asked (by the people), "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! How does a man curse his parents?" The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "'The man abuses the father of another man and the latter abuses the father of the former and abuses his mother.

Sahih al-Bukhari 5973

Narrated `Abdullah and Abu Musa:The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

إِنَّ بَيْنَ يَدَىِ السَّاعَةِ لأَيَّامًا يَنْزِلُ فِيهَا الْجَهْلُ، وَيُرْفَعُ فِيهَا الْعِلْمُ، وَيَكْثُرُ فِيهَا الْهَرْجُ، وَالْهَرْجُ الْقَتْلُ

"Near the establishment of the Hour there will be days during which Religious ignorance will spread, knowledge will be taken away (vanish) and there will be much Al-Harj, and Al- Harj means killing.

Sahih al-Bukhari 7062, 7063

Narrated Abu Musa:The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ حَمَلَ عَلَيْنَا السِّلاَحَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَّا ‏

Whoever takes up arms against us, is not from us.

Sahih al-Bukhari 7071

Footnote:

Without the right of qisās (the legal right in Islamic law to inflict an equivalent punishment on someone who has wrongfully injured or killed another) and unjustly.

Zuhaīr ibn Harb (rahimahullah) … narrated from Abu Hurairah (radiyallahu ‘anhu) that he said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ حَلَفَ عَلَى يَمِينٍ فَرَأَى غَيْرَهَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا فَلْيَأْتِ الَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ وَلْيُكَفِّرْ عَنْ يَمِينِهِ

Whoever swears an oath and then sees something better than it, let him do that which is better and offer expiation for his oath.

Sahih Muslim: 4127

Abu Umamah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:

اقْرَؤُوا القُرْآنَ ؛ فَإِنَّهُ يَأتِي يَوْمَ القِيَامَةِ شَفِيعاً لأَصْحَابِهِ

I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "Read the Qur'an, for it will come as an intercessor for its reciters on the Day of Resurrection.

Riyad as-Salihin 991

An-Nawwas bin Sam'an (May Allah be pleased with him) reported:

يُؤْتَى يَوْمَ القِيَامَةِ بِالقُرْآنِ وَأَهْلِهِ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ بِهِ فِي الدُّنْيَا تَقْدُمُهُ سُورَةُ البَقَرَةِ وَآلِ عِمْرَانَ، تُحَاجَّانِ عَنْ صَاحِبِهِمَا.

I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying, "The Qur'an and its people who applied it, will be brought on the Day of Resurrection preceded with Surat Al-Baqarah and Surat Al-'Imran arguing on behalf of those who applied them.

Muslim: 508 Tirmizi: 2883

Narrated Anas bin Malik:

مَنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يُبْسَطَ لَهُ فِي رِزْقِهِ، وَيُنْسَأَ لَهُ فِي أَثَرِهِ، فَلْيَصِلْ رَحِمَهُ

Allah 's Apostle said, "Whoever loves that he be granted more wealth and that his lease of life be prolonged then he should keep good relations with his Kith and kin.

Sahih al-Bukhari 5986

Narrated Abu Huraira: The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

إِنَّ الرَّحِمَ سُجْنَةٌ مِنَ الرَّحْمَنِ، فَقَالَ اللَّهُ مَنْ وَصَلَكِ وَصَلْتُهُ، وَمَنْ قَطَعَكِ قَطَعْتُهُ

"The word 'Ar-Rahm (womb) derives its name from Ar-Rahman (i.e., one of the names of Allah) and Allah said: 'I will keep good relation with the one who will keep good relation with you, (womb i.e. Kith and Kin) and sever the relation with him who will sever the relation with you.

Sahih al-Bukhari 5988

Fotnote:

By rahim relationship is meant your blood relatives, whether or not you have any inheritance ties with them.

Narrated Abu Qatada:

خَرَجَ عَلَيْنَا النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَأُمَامَةُ بِنْتُ أَبِي الْعَاصِ عَلَى عَاتِقِهِ، فَصَلَّى فَإِذَا رَكَعَ وَضَعَهَا، وَإِذَا رَفَعَ رَفَعَهَا‏.‏

The Prophet (ﷺ) came out towards us, while carrying Umamah, the daughter of Abi Al-As (his granddaughter) over his shoulder. He prayed, and when he wanted to bow, he put her down, and when he stood up, he lifted her up.

Sahih al-Bukhari 5996

Allah says in the Qur'an:

وَ اِذَا سَاَلَكَ عِبَادِیْ عَنِّیْ فَاِنِّیْ قَرِیْبٌ ؕ اُجِیْبُ دَعْوَةَ الدَّاعِ اِذَا دَعَانِ ۙ فَلْیَسْتَجِیْبُوْا لِیْ وَ لْیُؤْمِنُوْا بِیْ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَرْشُدُوْنَ۝۱۸۶

When My servants ask you about Me, I am indeed near. I respond to the call of the caller when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me and believe in Me that they may be rightly guided.

(Surah Al-Baqarah, Ayah 186)

It was narrated that Ibn 'Abbas said: The Messenger of Allah said:

الْعَائِدُ فِي هِبَتِهِ كَالْكَلْبِ يَقِيءُ ثُمَّ يَعُودُ فِي قَيْئِهِ

The one who takes back his gift is like the dog which vomits then goes back to its vomit.

Ibn-Mazah: 2383

Fotnote

However, in certain cases, a gift may be taken back even after it has been given, such as:

If, at the time of giving the gift, a condition was stipulated and that condition is not fulfilled, the gift may be revoked.

If the recipient (the one who received the gift) obtained it through fraud or illegal means, the giver may seek the court’s assistance to have the gift annulled.

However, the act of a father reclaiming a gift from his son is supported by Islamic law, whereas in other cases, reclaiming a gift is generally discouraged.

It was narrated that Anas said: The Messenger of Allah said:

The holy Quran states:

اِیَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَ اِیَّاكَ نَسْتَعِیْنُ

You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help.

Sura Fatiha, Ayat : 4

Footnote

No one is worthy of worship and devotion in any form except for Allah the Almighty. And for every task, true help should be sought only from Allah, as there is no one else who can truly execute any matter except Him.

The help that is sometimes sought from people in various worldly affairs is not sought with the belief that they are the ultimate executors. Rather, it is sought by considering them a mere external 'means' or 'cause.' This is not impermissible. However, to seek help from other than Allah for matters that are beyond the apparent means and causes is in no way permissible. This falls under the category of polytheism (shirk), such as asking for children, sustenance, and healing, etc., from anyone but Allah. [Source: Tafsir-e Tawzihul Qur'an]
