It was narrated from Anas bin Malik that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ سَأَلَ الْقَضَاءَ وُكِلَ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ وَمَنْ جُبِرَ عَلَيْهِ نَزَلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَسَدَّدَهُ

Whoever asks to be appointed a judge, will be entrusted to himself, but “Whoever asks to be appointed a judge, will be entrusted to himself, but whoever is forced to accept position, an angel will come down to him and guide him.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2309

It was narrated that 'Ali said:

بَعَثَنِي رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِلَى الْيَمَنِ فَقُلْتُ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ تَبْعَثُنِي وَأَنَا شَابٌّ أَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ وَلاَ أَدْرِي مَا الْقَضَاءُ قَالَ فَضَرَبَ فِي صَدْرِي بِيَدِهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ ‏ "‏ اللَّهُمَّ اهْدِ قَلْبَهُ وَثَبِّتْ لِسَانَهُ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ فَمَا شَكَكْتُ بَعْدُ فِي قَضَاءٍ بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ.

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) sent me to Yemen. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, you are sending me to judge between them while I am a young man, and I do not know how to judge.' He struck me on the chest with his hand and said: 'O Allah, guide his heart and make his tongue steadfast.' And after that I never doubted in passing judgment between two people.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2310

Narrated Aisha, Ummul Mu'minin: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) commanded us:

أَمَرَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِبِنَاءِ الْمَسَاجِدِ فِي الدُّورِ وَأَنْ تُنَظَّفَ وَتُطَيَّبَ

to build mosques in different localities (i.e. in the locality of each tribe separately) and that they should be kept clean and be perfumed.

Sunan Abi Dawud 455

Narrated Maymunah ibn Sa'd: I said: Messenger of Allah, tell us the legal injunction about (visiting) Bayt al-Muqaddas (the dome of the Rock at Jerusalem). The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

ائْتُوهُ فَصَلُّوا فِيهِ وَكَانَتِ الْبِلاَدُ إِذْ ذَاكَ حَرْبًا - فَإِنْ لَمْ تَأْتُوهُ وَتُصَلُّوا فِيهِ فَابْعَثُوا بِزَيْتٍ يُسْرَجُ فِي قَنَادِيلِهِ

go and pray there. All the cities at that time were effected by war. If you cannot visit it and pray there, then send some oil to be used in the lamps.

Sunan Abi Dawud 457

Footnote:

In this hadith, encouragement has been given to donate to the mosque.

Abu Hurairah reported:I heard the Messenger of Allah (May peace be upon him) as saying;

مَنْ سَمِعَ رَجُلاً يَنْشُدُ ضَالَّةً فِي الْمَسْجِدِ فَلْيَقُلْ لاَ أَدَّاهَا اللَّهُ إِلَيْكَ فَإِنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لَمْ تُبْنَ لِهَذَا

if anyone hears a man crying out in the mosque about something he has lost, he should say: May Allah not restore it to you, for the mosque were not built for this.

Sunan Abi Dawud 473

Ibn Abbas narrated:

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم خَرَجَ مِنَ الْمَدِينَةِ إِلَى مَكَّةَ لاَ يَخَافُ إِلاَّ اللَّهَ رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ فَصَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ

The Prophet went from Al-Madinah to Makkah, not fearing anyone except Allah the Lord of the worlds, and he prayed two Rak'ah.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi 547

It was narrated from Abu Shuraih Al-Khuzai that the Prophet(ﷺ) said:

مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيُحْسِنْ إِلَى جَارِهِ وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيُكْرِمْ ضَيْفَهُ وَمَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الآخِرِ فَلْيَقُلْ خَيْرًا أَوْ لِيَسْكُتْ

Whoever believes in the Last Day, let him treat his neighbour well. Whoever believes in Allah and Last Day, let him honor his guest. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him say something good or else remain silent

Sunan Ibn Majah 3672

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah(ﷺ) said:

اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أُحَرِّجُ حَقَّ الضَّعِيفَيْنِ الْيَتِيمِ وَالْمَرْأَةِ ‏

O Allah, bear witness that I have issued a warning concerning (failure to fulfill) the rights of the two weak ones: Orphans and women.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3678

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah(ﷺ) said:

خَيْرُ بَيْتٍ فِي الْمُسْلِمِينَ بَيْتٌ فِيهِ يَتِيمٌ يُحْسَنُ إِلَيْهِ وَشَرُّ بَيْتٍ فِي الْمُسْلِمِينَ بَيْتٌ فِيهِ يَتِيمٌ يُسَاءُ إِلَيْهِ

The best house among the Muslims is a house in which there is an orphan who is treated well. And the worst house among the Muslims is a house in which there is an orphan who is treated badly.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3679

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

تَبٰرَكَ الَّذِیْ بِیَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ ؗ وَ هُوَ عَلٰی كُلِّ شَیْءٍ قَدِیْرُۙ۝۱ ِ۟

Glorious is He, in whose hand is the Kingdom (of the whole universe), and He is powerful over every thing.

Surah Mulk, V : 1

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

الَّذِیْ خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَ الْحَیٰوةَ لِیَبْلُوَكُمْ اَیُّكُمْ اَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ؕ وَ هُوَ الْعَزِیْزُ الْغَفُوْرُۙ۝۲

[He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is the best in deed - and He is the All-Mighty, the Most-Forgiving.

Surah Mulk, V : 2

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

الَّذِیْ خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمٰوٰتٍ طِبَاقًا ؕ مَا تَرٰی فِیْ خَلْقِ الرَّحْمٰنِ مِنْ تَفٰوُتٍ ؕ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ ۙ هَلْ تَرٰی مِنْ فُطُوْرٍ۝۳

who has created seven skies, one over the other. You will see nothing out of proportion in the creation of the RaHmān (the All-Merciful Allah). So, cast your eye again. Do you see any rifts?

Surah Mulk, V : 3

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

قُلۡ اَئِنَّکُمۡ لَتَکۡفُرُوۡنَ بِالَّذِیۡ خَلَقَ الۡاَرۡضَ فِیۡ یَوۡمَیۡنِ وَتَجۡعَلُوۡنَ لَہٗۤ اَنۡدَادًا ؕ ذٰلِکَ رَبُّ الۡعٰلَمِیۡنَ

Say, “Do you really disbelieve in the One who has created the earth in two days, and attribute to Him equals? That is the Lord of the worlds."

Surah Hameem Sijda (Fussilat), v : 9

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَلَا یَـُٔوۡدُہٗ حِفۡظُہُمَا ۚ وَہُوَ الۡعَلِیُّ الۡعَظِیۡمُ

It does not weary Him to look after them (the Heavens and the Earth). He is the All-High, the Supreme.

Surah Al-Baqarah, verse: 255

Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:“May his nose be rubbed in dust! May his nose be rubbed in dust!! May his nose be rubbed in dust!!!”The Companions asked, “Whose nose, O Messenger of Allah?”He replied:

مَنْ أَدْرَكَ وَالِدَيْهِ عِنْدَ الْكِبْرِ، أَوْ أَحَدَهُمَا، فَدَخَلَ النَّارَ‏.‏

The one who finds his parents, or one of them, in their old age, yet he still enters the Hellfire.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 21

Abu Hurairah (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

ثَلاَثُ دَعَوَاتٍ مُسْتَجَابَاتٌ لَهُنَّ، لاَ شَكَّ فِيهِنَّ‏:‏ دَعْوَةُ الْمَظْلُومِ، وَدَعْوَةُ الْمُسَافِرِ، وَدَعْوَةُ الْوَالِدِيْنِ عَلَى وَلَدِهِمَا‏.‏

Three supplications are surely answered, about which there is no doubt: the supplication of the oppressed, the supplication of the traveler, and the supplication of the parents against their child.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 32

Sahl ibn Mu‘adh, on the authority of his father, reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ بَرَّ وَالِدَيْهِ طُوبَى لَهُ، زَادَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ فِي عُمْرِهِ‏.‏

Glad tidings for the one who treats his parents kindly; Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will increase his lifespan.

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 22

Abu Hurairah (RA) reported that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَجْزِي وَلَدٌ وَالِدَهُ، إِلاَّ أَنْ يَجِدَهُ مَمْلُوكًا فَيَشْتَرِيَهُ فَيُعْتِقَهُ‏.‏

A son cannot repay his father for what he has done for him, except if he finds him as a slave, then buys him and sets him free

Al-Adab al-Mufrad, 10

It was narrated from Anas that he used to drink from a vessel in three draughts, and Anas said that

وَزَعَمَ أَنَسٌ أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ـ صلى الله عليه وسلم ـ كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ ثَلاَثًا ‏.‏

the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to drink from a vessel in three draughts.

Sunan Ibn Majah 3416

Narrated Jundub RA. :The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ قَالَ فِي كِتَابِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ بِرَأْيِهِ فَأَصَابَ فَقَدْ أَخْطَأَ

If anyone interprets the Book of Allah in the light of his opinion even if he is right, he has erred.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3652

Fotnote:

It is not permissible to interpret the Qur’an according to one’s own desires; rather, it is necessary to follow and emulate the explanations of the Sahabah and the Tabi‘in. This is because the interpretations they presented were directly, or indirectly, received from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), and thus represent the correct explanation. On the other hand, those who interpret the Qur’an based merely on their own understanding cannot produce an explanation equal in authenticity to the aforementioned interpretations.

Narrated AbuHurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ سُئِلَ عَنْ عِلْمٍ فَكَتَمَهُ أَلْجَمَهُ اللَّهُ بِلِجَامٍ مِنْ نَارٍ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

He who is asked something he knows and conceals it will have a bridle of fire put on him on the Day of Resurrection.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3658

Narrated AbuHurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ أَفْتَى بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ كَانَ إِثْمُهُ عَلَى مَنْ أَفْتَاهُ

If anyone is given a legal decision ignorantly, the sin rests on the one who gave it.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3657

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ عِبَادُ الرَّحْمٰنِ الَّذِیْنَ یَمْشُوْنَ عَلَی الْاَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَّ اِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجٰهِلُوْنَ قَالُوْا سَلٰمًا۝۶۳

And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them, they say words of peace.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 63

`Abd Allah bin al-Zubair said on the authority of the father :I asked al-Zubair : What prevents you from narrating traditions from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as his Companions narrate from him? He said: By Allah I was very close to him. But I heard him (ﷺ) say:

مَنْ كَذَبَ عَلَىَّ مُتَعَمِّدًا فَلْيَتَبَوَّأْ مَقْعَدَهُ مِنَ النَّارِ

He who lies about me deliberately will certainly come to his abode in Hell.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3651

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ یَبِیْتُوْنَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَّ قِیَامًا۝۶۴ وَ الَّذِیْنَ یَقُوْلُوْنَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖۗ اِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًاۗۖ۝۶۵

And (Rahman's slaves are) those who spend the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]. And those who say, “Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Jahannam (the Hell); indeed, its punishment is a persisting affliction.”

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 64-65

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ اِذَاۤ اَنْفَقُوْا لَمْ یُسْرِفُوْا وَ لَمْ یَقْتُرُوْا وَ كَانَ بَیْنَ ذٰلِكَ قَوَامًا۝۶۷

And [Rahman's slaves are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 67

Narrated Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ عِلْمًا مِمَّا يُبْتَغَى بِهِ وَجْهُ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ لاَ يَتَعَلَّمُهُ إِلاَّ لِيُصِيبَ بِهِ عَرَضًا مِنَ الدُّنْيَا لَمْ يَجِدْ عَرْفَ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ " . يَعْنِي رِيحَهَا .

If anyone acquires knowledge that should be sought seeking the Face of Allah, but he acquires it only to get some worldly advantage, he will not experience the arf, i.e. the fragrance, of Paradise.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3664

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَالَّذِیۡنَ لَا یَدۡعُوۡنَ مَعَ اللّٰہِ اِلٰـہًا اٰخَرَ وَلَا یَقۡتُلُوۡنَ النَّفۡسَ الَّتِیۡ حَرَّمَ اللّٰہُ اِلَّا بِالۡحَقِّ وَلَا یَزۡنُوۡنَ

And (Rahman's slaves are) those who do not invoke any other god along with Allah, and do not kill a person whom Allah has given sanctity, except rightfully, nor do they commit unlawful sexual intercourse.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 68

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یُّضٰعَفۡ لَہُ الۡعَذَابُ یَوۡمَ الۡقِیٰمَۃِ وَیَخۡلُدۡ فِیۡہٖ مُہَانًا

(Whoever worships other gods with Allah, kills a soul unjustly, or commits adultery) the punishment will be doubled for him, and he will remain there disdained, for ever.

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 69

Narrated Abdullah ibn Abbas: The Prophet (ﷺ) said:

تَسْمَعُونَ وَيُسْمَعُ مِنْكُمْ وَيُسْمَعُ مِمَّنْ سَمِعَ مِنْكُمْ

You hear (from me), and others will hear from you; and people will hear from them who heard from you.

Sunan Abi Dawud 3659

Narrated Abu Sa`id Al-Khudri:Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ النِّدَاءَ فَقُولُوا مِثْلَ ما يَقُولُ الْمُؤَذِّنُ

Whenever you hear the Adhan, say what the Mu'adh-dhin is saying.

Sahih al-Bukhari 611

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِلَّا مَنۡ تَابَ وَاٰمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَاُولٰٓئِکَ یُبَدِّلُ اللّٰہُ سَیِّاٰتِہِمۡ حَسَنٰتٍ ؕ وَکَانَ اللّٰہُ غَفُوۡرًا رَّحِیۡمًا

except the one who repents and believes and does good deeds, then Allah will replace the evils of such people by good deeds, and Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 70

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَالَّذِیۡنَ یَقُوۡلُوۡنَ رَبَّنَا ہَبۡ لَنَا مِنۡ اَزۡوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّیّٰتِنَا قُرَّۃَ اَعۡیُنٍ وَّاجۡعَلۡنَا لِلۡمُتَّقِیۡنَ اِمَامًا

And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."

Surah Al-Furqan, v : 74

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوْا وَ یُلَقَّوْنَ فِیْهَا تَحِیَّةً وَّ سَلٰمًاۙ۝۷۵ خٰلِدِیْنَ فِیْهَا ؕ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَّ مُقَامًا۝۷۶

Those will be awarded with the high place - because they observed patience - and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace. living in it (the Paradise) for ever. It is best as an abode and as a place to dwell in.

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 75-76

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ لَا یَشْهَدُوْنَ الزُّوْرَ ۙ وَ اِذَا مَرُّوْا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوْا كِرَامًا۝۷۲ وَ الَّذِیْنَ اِذَا ذُكِّرُوْا بِاٰیٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ یَخِرُّوْا عَلَیْهَا صُمًّا وَّ عُمْیَانًا

and those who do not witness falsehood, and when they pass by the absurd things, Pass by them with dignity, and those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall at them as deaf and blind ones, ‍

Surah Al-Furqan, V : 72-73

Footnote :

The righteous servants of Allah embrace the verses of the Quran with sincere interest. They listen to its message attentively and, with open eyes and ears, strive to understand and internalize the truth to which it draws their attention. (Taqi Usmani)

Abu Hurairah (RA) reported: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

يَقْبِضُ اللَّهُ الْأَرْضَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَطْوِي السَّمَاءَ بِيَمِينِهِ ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: أَنَا الْمَلِكُ أَيْنَ مُلُوكُ الْأَرْضِ؟

On the Day of Resurrection Allah will grasp the earth in His Hand, and He will roll up the heavens in His Right Hand. Then He will say: ‘I am the King! Where are the kings of the earth?

Sahih al-Bukhari 4812; Sahih Muslim 2787 (23); Sunan Abi Dawud 4732

Narrated Abu Hurayrah (RA): He said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

بَادرُوا بِالْأَعْمَالِ فِتناً كَقِطَعِ اللَّيْلِ الْمُظْلِمِ يُصْبِحُ الرَّجُلُ مُؤْمِنًا وَيُمْسِي كَافِرًا وَيُمْسِي مُؤْمِنًا وَيُصْبِحُ كَافِرًا يَبِيعُ دِينَهُ بِعرْض من الدُّنْيَا.

Hasten to perform good deeds before you are overtaken by trials like pieces of a dark night, when a man will wake up as a believer and reach the evening as a disbeliever, or he will reach the evening as a believer and wake up as a disbeliever. He will sell his religion for some worldly gain.

(Sahih Muslim, 186 [118]; Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, 2195)

Fotnote:

In the mentioned hadith, it has been instructed to hasten in doing righteous deeds before the widespread occurrence of trials (fitan). By fitnah is meant the severe conflicts among Muslims over matters of religion and worldly affairs, leading to killing, looting, clashes, and extreme disagreements. During such times, ordinary Muslims will not be able to perform acts of worship and servitude to Allah in safety.

The severity of these trials will be so intense that within a single day people may lose their faith, from morning to evening or evening to morning. The trials of that time have been likened to the dark night, signifying their mysterious obscurity. Their causes will be difficult to uncover, and finding ways of salvation from them will also become extremely hard.

Narrated Abu Hurayrah (RA): He said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

يُسَلِّمُ الصَّغِيرُ عَلَى الْكَبِيرِ وَالْمَارُّ عَلَى الْقَاعِدِ وَالْقَلِيلُ عَلَى الْكَثِيرِ

The younger should greet the elder, the one passing by should greet the one who is sitting, and the smaller group should greet the larger group.

Sahih al-Bukhari, 6231, 6234; Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, 2704

It was narrated that Nafi' said: I used to send trade goods to Sham and Egypt, then I prepared to send trade goods to 'Iraq. I went to 'Aishah, the Mother of the Believers, and said to her: " O Mother of the Believers I used to send trade goods to Sham and I am preparing to send trade goods to 'Iraq." She said: "Do not do that. What is wrong with the way you have been doing it? I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say:

إِذَا سَبَّبَ اللَّهُ لأَحَدِكُمْ رِزْقًا مِنْ وَجْهٍ فَلاَ يَدَعْهُ حَتَّى يَتَغَيَّرَ لَهُ أَوْ يَتَنَكَّرَ لَهُ

If Allah causes provision to come to one of you through a certain means, he should not leave it unless it changes or deteriorates.

Mishkat: 2785

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

مَا بَعَثَ اللَّهُ نَبِيًّا إِلاَّ رَاعِيَ غَنَمٍ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ لَهُ أَصْحَابُهُ وَأَنْتَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ‏.‏ قَالَ ‏"‏ وَأَنَا كُنْتُ أَرْعَاهَا لأَهْلِ مَكَّةَ بِالْقَرَارِيطِ ‏"‏ ‏.‏ قَالَ سُوَيْدٌ يَعْنِي كُلُّ شَاةٍ بِقِيرَاطٍ ‏.‏

Allah has not sent any Prophet but he was a shepherd." His Companions said to him: "Even you, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Even me I used to tend the sheep of the people of Makkah for a few Qirats." (Sahih) (One of the narrators) Suwaid said: " Meaning one Qirat for every sheep

Sahihul Bukhari: 2262

Fotnote:

"Qirat" is an Arabic unit of measurement, commonly used for land measurement. It is primarily prevalent in the Middle East and some regions of South Asia.

It was narrated from Ma'mar bin 'Abdullah bin Nadlah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَحْتَكِرُ إِلاَّ خَاطِئٌ

No one hoards but a sinner.

Muslim: 1605, Tirmiji: 1267

It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin Abu Awfa that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

إِنَّ اللَّهَ مَعَ الْقَاضِي مَا لَمْ يَجُرْ فَإِذَا جَارَ وَكَلَهُ إِلَى نَفْسِهِ

Allah is with the judge so long as he is not unjust, but if he rules unjustly, He entrusts him to himself.

Tirmiji: 1330

It was narrated from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لَعْنَةُ اللَّهِ عَلَى الرَّاشِي وَالْمُرْتَشِي

The curse of Allah is upon the one who offers a bribe and the one who takes it.

Tirmiji: 1337

It was narrated from 'Amr bin 'As that he heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say:

إِذَا حَكَمَ الْحَاكِمُ فَاجْتَهَدَ فَأَصَابَ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ وَإِذَا حَكَمَ فَاجْتَهَدَ فَأَخْطَأَ فَلَهُ أَجْرٌ

When the judge passes a judgement and does his best and gets it right, he will have two rewards, and if he passes a judgement and does his best and gets it wrong, he will have one reward.

It was narrated from 'Abdul-Malik bin 'Umair that he heard 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abu Bakrah (narrate) from his father that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لاَ يَقْضِي الْقَاضِي بَيْنَ اثْنَيْنِ وَهُوَ غَضْبَانُ

Let the judge (Qadi) not pass a judgment when he is angry.

Sahihul bukhari: 7158

Abu Huraira reported this directly from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ):

مَا أَذِنَ اللَّهُ لِشَىْءٍ مَا أَذِنَ لِنَبِيٍّ يَتَغَنَّى بِالْقُرْآنِ ‏"

God has not listened to anything as He listens to a Prophet reciting the Qur'an in a sweet voice.

Sahih Muslim 792

Allah (SWT) says in the Holy Quran

اَلَاۤ اِنَّ اَوْلِیَآءَ اللّٰهِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَۚۖ۝۶۲ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ كَانُوْا یَتَّقُوْنَؕ۝۶۳ لَهُمُ الْبُشْرٰی فِی الْحَیٰوةِ الدُّنْیَا وَ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ ؕ لَا تَبْدِیْلَ لِكَلِمٰتِ اللّٰهِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِیْمُؕ۝۶۴

Remember that those who are friends of Allah will have no fear, nor will they grieve. They are those who believe and are God-fearing (possess taqwa). For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. There is no change in the words of Allah. That is the great success.

Surah Yunus, Verses 62-64

Footnote

No matter how happy a person is in this world, they will always have some fear about the future and some sorrow about the past. However, the friends of Allah will have no such sorrow or fear in Paradise.

The good tidings in the worldly life are received in various ways. For example, angels give them glad tidings at the time of their death, they or others about them are shown good dreams, Allah gives them special help in various matters, and they become well-known and famous among people etc.

[Based on the Bengali translation of Tafsir Tawzeehul Quran]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that:the Prophet said:

تُنْكَحُ النِّسَاءُ لِأَرْبَعٍ لِمَالِهَا وَلِحَسَبِهَا وَلِجَمَالِهَا وَلِدِينِهَا فَاظْفَرْ بِذَاتِ الدِّينِ تَرِبَتْ يَدَاكَ

A woman may be married for four things: Her wealth, her lineage, her beauty or for her religion. Choose the religious, may your hands be rubbed with dust (i.e., may you prosper).

Sunan Ibn Majah 1858

Fotnote:

“تَرِبَتْ يَدَاكَ” – Meaning:

The literal meaning is: “May your hands be covered with dust.”

But in Arabic, this expression is used as a form of supplication or strong emphasis. Here, it means—

“If you choose a religious woman, you will be successful.”

Yahya related to me from Malik from Ibn Shihab from Ali ibn Husayn ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said,

Abu Umamah (May Allah be pleased with him) reported: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying,

اقْرَؤُوا القُرْآنَ ؛ فَإِنَّهُ يَأتِي يَوْمَ القِيَامَةِ شَفِيعاً لأَصْحَابِهِ

مَن تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الوُضُوءَ، خَرَجَتْ خَطَايَاهُ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ حَتَّى تَخْرُج مِنْ تَحْتِ أَظْفَارِه

Muatta Malik: 1887

It was narrated from Samurah that:The Prophet [SAW] said:

الْبَسُوا مِنْ ثِيَابِكُمْ الْبَيَاضَ فَإِنَّهَا أَطْهَرُ وَأَطْيَبُ وَكَفِّنُوا فِيهَا مَوْتَاكُمْ قَالَ يَحْيَى لَمْ أَكْتُبْهُ قُلْتُ لِمَ قَالَ اسْتَغْنَيْتُ بِحَدِيثِ مَيْمُونِ بْنِ أَبِي شَبِيبٍ عَنْ سَمُرَةَ

Wear white garments, for they are purer and better, and shroud your dead in them.

Sunan An Nasai: 3567

In the Holy Quran, Allaays:

فَاِذَا قَضَیْتُمْ مَّنَاسِكَكُمْ فَاذْكُرُوا اللّٰهَ كَذِكْرِكُمْ اٰبَآءَكُمْ اَوْ اَشَدَّ ذِكْرًا ؕ فَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ یَّقُوْلُ رَبَّنَاۤ اٰتِنَا فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ مَا لَهٗ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ مِنْ خَلَاقٍ۝۲۰۰

When you have completed your pilgrimage, remember Allah as you remember your forefathers, or even more. Some people there are who say (in prayer) only, "Our Lord! Give us good in this world." And they have no share in the Hereafter.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 200

Footnote:

A custom of the Age of Ignorance (Jahiliyyah) was that after completing the fundamental rites of Hajj, when they gathered in Mina, some people would spend an entire day describing the praises and glories of their forefathers. This verse alludes to that custom of theirs. Furthermore, some people would make supplication (Dua), but since they did not believe in the Hereafter (Akhirah), their Dua was limited only to seeking the welfare of the world. In contrast, the duty of a believer is to seek goodness in both the world and the Hereafter.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنْهُمْ مَّنْ یَّقُوْلُ رَبَّنَاۤ اٰتِنَا فِی الدُّنْیَا حَسَنَةً وَّ فِی الْاٰخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَّ قِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ۝۲۰۱

And among them are some who say, "Our Lord! Grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 201

Footnote:

A discerning believer prays for the welfare of both this world and the Hereafter. This prayer is exceptionally comprehensive.

The good of this world includes things like good health, peace and security, a contented family life, and comfortable sustenance. The good of the Hereafter, on the other hand, includes peace in the grave, an easy reckoning, deliverance from Hellfire, and the attainment of Paradise. Everything is encompassed within this concise supplication. (Tawzihul Quran)

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ یَّشْرِیْ نَفْسَهُ ابْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ رَءُوْفٌۢ بِالْعِبَادِ۝۲۰۷

And among the people is he who sells himself seeking the pleasure of Allah. And Allah is most compassionate to [His] servants.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 207

Footnote:

This refers to those companions of the Prophet who sacrificed their lives for Islam. For example : Hazrat Ammar, Suhaib RA

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوا ادْخُلُوْا فِی السِّلْمِ كَآفَّةً ۪ وَّ لَا تَتَّبِعُوْا خُطُوٰتِ الشَّیْطٰنِ ؕ اِنَّهٗ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِیْنٌ۝۲۰۸

O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 208

Footnote:

Some of the Jews who converted to Islam wanted to continue practicing certain rituals of Judaism as before. In response, this verse was revealed. It was an instruction to enter Islam completely, in mind, body, thought, belief, and action. The guidance given to you in the Quran and Sunnah is sufficient for you. Therefore, follow only that. Completely abandon the mental weakness of adopting anything from other religions or ideologies, or following fabricated customs, innovations (bid'ah), superstitions, and the like. Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

هَلْ یَنْظُرُوْنَ اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّاْتِیَهُمُ اللّٰهُ فِیْ ظُلَلٍ مِّنَ الْغَمَامِ وَ الْمَلٰٓىِٕكَةُ وَ قُضِیَ الْاَمْرُ ؕ وَ اِلَی اللّٰهِ تُرْجَعُ الْاُمُوْرُ۠۝۲۱۰

Are they waiting for anything other than that Allah should come to them in the shadows of the clouds, and the angels, and the matter is decided? And to Allah all matters are returned.

Footnote :

Various disbelievers, especially the Jews of Medina, used to make such demands: "Why doesn't Allah Himself appear directly before our eyes and command us to believe?" This verse is a response to that. The gist of the reply is that this world is essentially a place of trial. The test is whether a person uses their intellect and judgment, and based on the clear signs scattered throughout the universe, comes to believe in the oneness of Allah (Tawheed) and the messengership of the Prophets. For this reason, true value in this test lies in belief in the unseen (Ghayb). If Allah were to be seen directly, where would the test be? It is a principle of Allah that if a person sees the unseen things with their own eyes, their belief is no longer acceptable. That is why the unseen things are not made visible. However, when this world is brought to an end and the time for punishment and reward arrives, some of the unseen things will be shown with the naked eye. The phrase "the matter is decided" in the verse refers to this.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

۠ وَ مَنْ یُّبَدِّلْ نِعْمَةَ اللّٰهِ مِنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ شَدِیْدُ الْعِقَابِ۝۲۱۱

And whoever changes the favor of Allah after it has come to him, then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

Footnote :

"Changing a favour" refers to being ungrateful for a blessing (Ni'mat). This verse was revealed concerning the Jews of the Children of Israel (Bani Israil). They constantly forgot the blessings granted by Allah and showed ingratitude towards Him. The verse serves as a warning regarding this very matter.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

كَانَ النَّاسُ اُمَّةً وَّاحِدَةً ۫ فَبَعَثَ اللّٰهُ النَّبِیّٖنَ مُبَشِّرِیْنَ وَ مُنْذِرِیْنَ ۪ وَ اَنْزَلَ مَعَهُمُ الْكِتٰبَ بِالْحَقِّ لِیَحْكُمَ بَیْنَ النَّاسِ فِیْمَا اخْتَلَفُوْا فِیْهِ ؕ وَ مَا اخْتَلَفَ فِیْهِ اِلَّا الَّذِیْنَ اُوْتُوْهُ مِنْۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ الْبَیِّنٰتُ بَغْیًۢا بَیْنَهُمْ ۚ فَهَدَی اللّٰهُ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لِمَا اخْتَلَفُوْا فِیْهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِاِذْنِهٖ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَهْدِیْ مَنْ یَّشَآءُ اِلٰی صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِیْمٍ۝۲۱۳

(Initially) All people were followers of a single religion. Then (when differences arose among them) Allah sent the prophets as bearers of good news (for the righteous) and as warners (for the liars). And He sent down with them the Book containing the truth, so that it might judge between people concerning the matters in which they differed. And it was no one else but those to whom the Book was given who differed in it (in that very Book), after the clear signs had come to them, only due to mutual envy. Then Allah guided the believers to the truth concerning the matter in which they differed, by His will. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

Surah: Al-Baqarah
Ayah: 213

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَمْ حَسِبْتُمْ اَنْ تَدْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ وَ لَمَّا یَاْتِكُمْ مَّثَلُ الَّذِیْنَ خَلَوْا مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ ؕ مَسَّتْهُمُ الْبَاْسَآءُ وَ الضَّرَّآءُ وَ زُلْزِلُوْا حَتّٰی یَقُوْلَ الرَّسُوْلُ وَ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا مَعَهٗ مَتٰی نَصْرُ اللّٰهِ ؕ اَلَاۤ اِنَّ نَصْرَ اللّٰهِ قَرِیْبٌ۝۲۱۴

Do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trials] have not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship, and they were shaken until [even] the Messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 214

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

قُلْ مَاۤ اَنْفَقْتُمْ مِّنْ خَیْرٍ فَلِلْوَالِدَیْنِ وَ الْاَقْرَبِیْنَ وَ الْیَتٰمٰی وَ الْمَسٰكِیْنِ وَ ابْنِ السَّبِیْلِ ؕ وَ مَا تَفْعَلُوْا مِنْ خَیْرٍ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ بِهٖ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۱۵

[O Muhammad,] ‍say, "Whatever you spend of good is [due] to parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 215

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

كُتِبَ عَلَیْكُمُ الْقِتَالُ وَ هُوَ كُرْهٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَ عَسٰۤی اَنْ تَكْرَهُوْا شَیْـًٔا وَّ هُوَ خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ ۚ وَ عَسٰۤی اَنْ تُحِبُّوْا شَیْـًٔا وَّ هُوَ شَرٌّ لَّكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُوْنَ۠۝۲۱۶

Fighting has been enjoined upon you, though it is disliked by you. But it is possible that you dislike a thing which is good for you, and it is possible that you like a thing which is bad for you. And Allah knows, while you know not.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 216

Footnote :

People often become devastated when their plans fail or disheartened when they face undesirable circumstances. However, we do not know the true good or harm; only Allah knows. Many times, what we desire may be harmful, and what we dislike may, in fact, be beneficial. Therefore, we must submit the final decision to Allah, obey His commands, and remain content with destiny (Qadar). If we observe patience (Sabr) when we do not attain desired things or when we face undesirable events, there is a great reward secured for us in the Hereafter. This lesson should be adhered to in all aspects of life, especially in Jihad.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَنْ یَّرْتَدِدْ مِنْكُمْ عَنْ دِیْنِهٖ فَیَمُتْ وَ هُوَ كَافِرٌ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ حَبِطَتْ اَعْمَالُهُمْ فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ الْاٰخِرَةِ ۚ وَ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ اَصْحٰبُ النَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِیْهَا خٰلِدُوْنَ۝۲۱۷

And whoever among you reverts from his religion and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 217

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَ الَّذِیْنَ هَاجَرُوْا وَ جٰهَدُوْا فِیْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ ۙ اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَرْجُوْنَ رَحْمَتَ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۝۲۱۸

Indeed, those who have believed, those who have emigrated and fought in the way of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving and Very-Merciful.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 218

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ مَا ذَا یُنْفِقُوْنَ ؕ۬ قُلِ الْعَفْوَ ؕ كَذٰلِكَ یُبَیِّنُ اللّٰهُ لَكُمُ الْاٰیٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَفَكَّرُوْنَۙ۝۲۱۹

They ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond your needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses so that you might give thought.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 219

Footnote :

In this verse, an important ruling regarding charity (Dan-Sadaqah) has been stated: The correct form of charity is that which is given from the surplus wealth after fulfilling one's own needs and the needs of one's family. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The best charity is that which is given when one is rich (i.e., maintaining one's self-sufficiency)."

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فِی الدُّنْیَا وَ الْاٰخِرَةِ ؕ وَ یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْیَتٰمٰی ؕ قُلْ اِصْلَاحٌ لَّهُمْ خَیْرٌ ؕ وَ اِنْ تُخَالِطُوْهُمْ فَاِخْوَانُكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ الْمُفْسِدَ مِنَ الْمُصْلِحِ ؕ وَ لَوْ شَآءَ اللّٰهُ لَاَعْنَتَكُمْ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ عَزِیْزٌ حَكِیْمٌ۝۲۲۰

And they ask you about orphans. Say, "To work for their good is good. If you mix with them, (it is all right;) they are your brothers. And Allah knows who is the mischief-maker and who is the peace-maker. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise."

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 220

Footnote :

When the Quran issued severe warnings about devouring the property of orphans (Surah An-Nisa 4:2, 10), the companions who were in charge of orphans began to exercise extreme caution with them. They even started cooking food for the orphans separately and feeding them separately. As a result, if some of their food was left over, it would go to waste. This caused both more difficulty and loss. This verse clarifies that the main objective is to look after the welfare of the orphans, not to put their guardians in difficulty. Therefore, there is no harm in cooking their food together and eating together. The condition is that their food expenses must be taken from their property with justice and fairness. If there is an unintentional slight discrepancy, it is forgivable. However, one must not knowingly cause them harm. Allah knows well who acts with justice and welfare and who has ill intentions.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا تَنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكٰتِ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنَّ ؕ وَ لَاَمَةٌ مُّؤْمِنَةٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكَةٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَتْكُمْ ۚ وَ لَا تُنْكِحُوا الْمُشْرِكِیْنَ حَتّٰی یُؤْمِنُوْا ؕ وَ لَعَبْدٌ مُّؤْمِنٌ خَیْرٌ مِّنْ مُّشْرِكٍ وَّ لَوْ اَعْجَبَكُمْ

And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not give your women in marriage to polytheistic men until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 221

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اُولٰٓىِٕكَ یَدْعُوْنَ اِلَی النَّارِ ۖۚ وَ اللّٰهُ یَدْعُوْۤا اِلَی الْجَنَّةِ وَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ بِاِذْنِهٖ ۚ وَ یُبَیِّنُ اٰیٰتِهٖ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ یَتَذَكَّرُوْنَ۠۝۲۲۱

Those (polytheistic men and women) invite to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that they may remember.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 221

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ یَسْـَٔلُوْنَكَ عَنِ الْمَحِیْضِ ؕ قُلْ هُوَ اَذًی ۙ فَاعْتَزِلُوا النِّسَآءَ فِی الْمَحِیْضِ ۙ وَ لَا تَقْرَبُوْهُنَّ حَتّٰی یَطْهُرْنَ ۚ فَاِذَا تَطَهَّرْنَ فَاْتُوْهُنَّ مِنْ حَیْثُ اَمَرَكُمُ اللّٰهُ ؕ

And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is an impurity, so keep away from women during menstruation and do not approach them (that is, do not engage in sexual intercourse) until they are purified." But when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordered you.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 222

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ اللّٰهَ یُحِبُّ التَّوَّابِیْنَ وَ یُحِبُّ الْمُتَطَهِّرِیْنَ۝۲۲۲

Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 222

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا تَجْعَلُوا اللّٰهَ عُرْضَةً لِّاَیْمَانِكُمْ اَنْ تَبَرُّوْا وَ تَتَّقُوْا وَ تُصْلِحُوْا بَیْنَ النَّاسِ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ سَمِیْعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۲۴

Do not make [the name of] Allah the subject of your oaths against your doing good, fearing Allah and setting things right between people. And Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 224

Footnote

If someone swears in the name of Allah not to do a good deed, for example, if they say, "By Allah, I will never do this good deed again," or "I will never give up this sinful act," or "I will never reconcile people again," then their duty is to perform the good deed (or give up the sinful act) instead of refraining from it due to the oath, and to offer the expiation (Kaffarah) for breaking the oath.

This verse warns against such wrong oaths taken in the name of Allah. It cautions that if you make an oath not to perform a good deed, do not use the name of Allah as an excuse not to do that good deed later on. Do not say, "I have sworn by Allah not to do this work; so how can I do it now!" Instead, break the oath, do the good deed, and pay the expiation (Kaffarah).

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَا یُؤَاخِذُكُمُ اللّٰهُ بِاللَّغْوِ فِیْۤ اَیْمَانِكُمْ وَ لٰكِنْ یُّؤَاخِذُكُمْ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ قُلُوْبُكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرٌ حَلِیْمٌ۝۲۲۵

Allah will not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for what your hearts have intended. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 225

Footnote

Meaningless oaths refer to two types of oaths: first, those made without the intention of swearing, but which are uttered habitually. For example, the Arabs would frequently say "Wallahi" (By Allah) in casual conversation without the intent of taking an oath; this is a meaningless oath. Second, a mistaken oath concerning a past event made out of ignorance. That is, the swearer believes he is speaking the truth, but in reality, it is not true. Allah will not hold a person accountable for this type of oath either. Nevertheless, people should exercise caution when swearing oaths and try to avoid these types of oaths.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لِلَّذِیْنَ یُؤْلُوْنَ مِنْ نِّسَآىِٕهِمْ تَرَبُّصُ اَرْبَعَةِ اَشْهُرٍ ۚ فَاِنْ فَآءُوْ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ غَفُوْرٌ رَّحِیْمٌ۝۲۲۶

For those who swear off relations with their wives (i.e., take an oath not to go near them) there is a waiting period of four months. If they return (to their wives by breaking the oath) during this time, then indeed Allah is Most-Forgiving and Very-Merciful.

Footnote :

Among the Arabs, an unjust practice was common where a man would swear an oath not to go to his wife. As a result, the wife would be left in a suspended state for an indefinite period; she would neither get her marital rights nor could she marry someone else. Such an oath is called 'Ila'.

This verse has legislated that a person who takes an oath of 'ila' has a grace period of four months to break the oath, pay the expiation, and restore normal marital relations with his wife. If he does not do so, and four months pass, their marriage will be dissolved without the husband having to issue a divorce.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الْمُطَلَّقٰتُ یَتَرَبَّصْنَ بِاَنْفُسِهِنَّ ثَلٰثَةَ قُرُوْٓءٍ ؕ وَ لَا یَحِلُّ لَهُنَّ اَنْ یَّكْتُمْنَ مَا خَلَقَ اللّٰهُ فِیْۤ اَرْحَامِهِنَّ اِنْ كُنَّ یُؤْمِنَّ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ ؕ وَ بُعُوْلَتُهُنَّ اَحَقُّ بِرَدِّهِنَّ فِیْ ذٰلِكَ اِنْ اَرَادُوْۤا اِصْلَاحًا ؕ

Divorced women must wait three menstrual cycles by themselves. It is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs (fetus or menstruation), if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. Their husbands have a greater right to take them back during this period, if they desire reconciliation.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 228

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَهُنَّ مِثْلُ الَّذِیْ عَلَیْهِنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ۪ وَ لِلرِّجَالِ عَلَیْهِنَّ دَرَجَةٌ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ عَزِیْزٌ حَكِیْمٌ۠۝۲۲۸

The wives have rights (over their husbands) similar to the rights (of their husbands) over them, according to what is reasonable. However, the men have a degree over them. And Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 228

Footnote

During the age of ignorance (Jahiliyyah), women had no recognized rights. This verse makes it clear that both husband and wife have rights over one another. However, it is undeniable that in life, Allah has made the husband the maintainer and protector, as is explicitly stated in Surah An-Nisa (4:34). In this respect, he has one degree of superiority.
Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلطَّلَاقُ مَرَّتٰنِ ۪ فَاِمْسَاكٌۢ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ اَوْ تَسْرِیْحٌۢ بِاِحْسَانٍ ؕ

Divorce is [permissible] two times. After that, [the husband must choose:] either retention with righteousness or a graceful release.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 229

Footnote :

In this verse, one instruction given is that if divorce must occur, it should be a maximum of two divorces. This is because in this state, there is an opportunity to maintain the relationship between the husband and wife, as the husband has the right to revoke the divorce during the waiting period (iddah). After the waiting period, they can remarry with mutual consent and a new dowry. However, if three divorces are given, both of these paths are closed. In that case, there is no way left to restore the relationship.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا یَحِلُّ لَكُمْ اَنْ تَاْخُذُوْا مِمَّاۤ اٰتَیْتُمُوْهُنَّ شَیْـًٔا اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّخَافَاۤ اَلَّا یُقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ؕ فَاِنْ خِفْتُمْ اَلَّا یُقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ۙ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَا فِیْمَا افْتَدَتْ بِهٖ ؕ تِلْكَ حُدُوْدُ اللّٰهِ فَلَا تَعْتَدُوْهَا ۚ وَ مَنْ یَّتَعَدَّ حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ هُمُ الظّٰلِمُوْنَ۝۲۲۹

It is not lawful for you [husbands] to take anything of what you have given them, unless both parties fear that they will not be able to keep within the limits of Allah. So if you fear that they will not be able to keep within the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them for what the wife gives back for her redemption. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 229

Footnote :

In normal circumstances, it is not permissible for the husband to demand the return or waiver of the dowry in exchange for the divorce. However, if the wife herself asks for the divorce, and it is not due to any oppression from the husband, but for some other reason—for example, the wife dislikes the husband, and because of this, they both fear they will not be able to comfortably fulfill their marital duties—then in this situation, it is permissible for the wife to return the full dowry or a part of it, or to waive it if it has not yet been paid (this is technically called 'khula').

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ مَنْ یَّتَعَدَّ حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ فَاُولٰٓىِٕكَ هُمُ الظّٰلِمُوْنَ۝۲۲۹

And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 229

Footnote :

Allah (SWT) has imposed various ordinances upon His servants. Each of the statutes given by Allah is a limit. It is not permissible for anyone to transgress these limits set by Allah. After forbidding the transgression of these limits in this verse, it is stated that those who violate the limits set by Allah are indeed great wrongdoers and transgressors.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَاِنْ طَلَّقَهَا فَلَا تَحِلُّ لَهٗ مِنْۢ بَعْدُ حَتّٰی تَنْكِحَ زَوْجًا غَیْرَهٗ ؕ فَاِنْ طَلَّقَهَا فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَاۤ اَنْ یَّتَرَاجَعَاۤ اِنْ ظَنَّاۤ اَنْ یُّقِیْمَا حُدُوْدَ اللّٰهِ ؕ وَ تِلْكَ حُدُوْدُ اللّٰهِ یُبَیِّنُهَا لِقَوْمٍ یَّعْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۳۰

And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until she marries another husband. And if he [the second husband] divorces her, there is no blame upon them for returning to one another if they think that they can keep within the limits of Allah. And those are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 230

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَآءَ فَبَلَغْنَ اَجَلَهُنَّ فَاَمْسِكُوْهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ اَوْ سَرِّحُوْهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوْفٍ ۪ وَّ لَا تُمْسِكُوْهُنَّ ضِرَارًا لِّتَعْتَدُوْا ۚ وَ مَنْ یَّفْعَلْ ذٰلِكَ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهٗ ؕ وَ لَا تَتَّخِذُوْۤا اٰیٰتِ اللّٰهِ هُزُوًا ؗ

And when you divorce women and they have almost fulfilled their term, then either retain them with righteousness or release them with righteousness. And do not retain them in order to harm them, so that you may transgress. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah as a mockery.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 231

Footnote :

The legal provisions given in the verse, such as marriage, divorce, 'ila', and 'khula', are extremely significant and beneficial. Therefore, do not use them for trickery or with malicious intent, such as taking a wife back after divorce with the intention of tormenting her. Or saying after a marriage, "My intention was not to marry, I was just having fun," or after a divorce, "I was just kidding." Doing so is tantamount to mocking the verses. So, abandon such methods and follow Allah's verses with a sincere heart. There is a Hadith that says three things, even if done in jest, become real: marriage, divorce, and raj'at (taking a wife back after a divorce).

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَآءَ فَبَلَغْنَ اَجَلَهُنَّ فَلَا تَعْضُلُوْهُنَّ اَنْ یَّنْكِحْنَ اَزْوَاجَهُنَّ اِذَا تَرَاضَوْا بَیْنَهُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ یُوْعَظُ بِهٖ مَنْ كَانَ مِنْكُمْ یُؤْمِنُ بِاللّٰهِ وَ الْیَوْمِ الْاٰخِرِ ؕ ذٰلِكُمْ اَزْكٰی لَكُمْ وَ اَطْهَرُ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَعْلَمُ وَ اَنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُوْنَ۝۲۳۲

And when you divorce women and they have fulfilled their term, do not prevent them from remarrying their [former] husbands if they agree among themselves in a reasonable manner. This is an admonition for whoever among you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is more virtuous and purer for you. And Allah knows, while you know not.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 232

Footnote :

"If the divorce is not three, but one or two, the husband may take his wife back during the 'iddah (waiting period). This is called Raja'ah (revocation), and it is applicable only in the case of a revocable divorce (Talaq-e-Raj'i). If three divorces have occurred, this opportunity is no longer available.

So, in a case where the wife could be taken back during the 'iddah, if the husband does not take her back and the 'iddah period ends, the couple can still remarry if they both agree. However, this time they must agree on a new Mahr (dower).

The guardians of the wife are instructed in this verse not to prevent this marriage; they should not let arrogance take hold of them, thinking, 'Why did this husband not take her back during the 'iddah?' If there is no religious objection according to the Shari'ah, it is not permissible for the guardians to obstruct the marriage merely out of arrogance."

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الْوَالِدٰتُ یُرْضِعْنَ اَوْلَادَهُنَّ حَوْلَیْنِ كَامِلَیْنِ لِمَنْ اَرَادَ اَنْ یُّتِمَّ الرَّضَاعَةَ ؕ

Mothers shall breastfeed their children for a full two years. (This duration is) for those who wish to complete the period of suckling.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 233

Footnote :

The maximum period for breastfeeding is two years. After this, it is necessary to wean the child off breast milk. And if both parents agree and believe it is better for the child, they can wean the child even before the two-year period is complete. Completing the two years is not obligatory.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَا تُكَلَّفُ نَفْسٌ اِلَّا وُسْعَهَا

No soul is burdened beyond its capacity.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 233

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

فَاِنْ اَرَادَا فِصَالًا عَنْ تَرَاضٍ مِّنْهُمَا وَ تَشَاوُرٍ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْهِمَا

If they both desire weaning by mutual consent and consultation, there is no blame upon them.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 233

Footnote :

Breastfeeding can be continued for a maximum of two years. After this, it is incumbent to wean the child from the mother's milk. However, the parents may also wean the child before two years if they deem it better for the child. Completing the two years is not Wajib (obligatory), and weaning before this period is not a form of Zulm (oppression or injustice) upon the child."

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِنْ اَرَدْتُّمْ اَنْ تَسْتَرْضِعُوْۤا اَوْلَادَكُمْ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْكُمْ اِذَا سَلَّمْتُمْ مَّاۤ اٰتَیْتُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ

And if you wish to have your children nursed by a wet nurse, there is no blame upon you as long as you pay what you agreed upon in a just manner.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 233

Footnote :

"If a child is handed over to a wet nurse for breastfeeding, then that wet nurse must be paid a fair wage. It is not wrong or unjust for the wet nurse to accept this remuneration."

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ الَّذِیْنَ یُتَوَفَّوْنَ مِنْكُمْ وَ یَذَرُوْنَ اَزْوَاجًا یَّتَرَبَّصْنَ بِاَنْفُسِهِنَّ اَرْبَعَةَ اَشْهُرٍ وَّ عَشْرًا

And those of you who die and leave wives behind - they shall wait by themselves for four months and ten days.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 234

Footnote

After the death of her husband, the wife must observe the 'Iddah (waiting period) of four months and ten days. This is mandatory.During the 'Iddah, a woman may not go outside unless absolutely necessary. She cannot adorn herself (wear makeup or jewelry). She also cannot marry anyone else during this time. Furthermore, even marriage proposals or discussions about marriage are not permissible while this 'Iddah is ongoing.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْكُمْ فِیْمَا عَرَّضْتُمْ بِهٖ مِنْ خِطْبَةِ النِّسَآءِ اَوْ اَكْنَنْتُمْ فِیْۤ اَنْفُسِكُمْ ؕ عَلِمَ اللّٰهُ اَنَّكُمْ سَتَذْكُرُوْنَهُنَّ وَ لٰكِنْ لَّا تُوَاعِدُوْهُنَّ سِرًّا اِلَّاۤ اَنْ تَقُوْلُوْا قَوْلًا مَّعْرُوْفًا ؕ۬ وَ لَا تَعْزِمُوْا عُقْدَةَ النِّكَاحِ حَتّٰی یَبْلُغَ الْكِتٰبُ اَجَلَهٗ ؕ وَ اعْلَمُوْۤا اَنَّ اللّٰهَ یَعْلَمُ مَا فِیْۤ اَنْفُسِكُمْ فَاحْذَرُوْهُ ۚ وَ اعْلَمُوْۤا اَنَّ اللّٰهَ غَفُوْرٌ حَلِیْمٌ۠۝۲۳۵

There is no blame upon you for what you allude to concerning a proposal to women or what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will be thinking of them, but do not promise them secretly except for saying a proper statement. And do not determine to consummate the marriage contract until the prescribed period reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is in your souls, so be wary of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 235

Footnote :

It is completely forbidden to propose marriage directly to a woman observing her waiting period (iddah) or to finalize an agreement with her that she will marry you after her iddah ends. However, the verse permits making veiled hints that allow the woman to understand that the person intends to propose after her waiting period. For example, a person can simply say, "I am also looking for a suitable spouse."

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

لَا جُنَاحَ عَلَیْكُمْ اِنْ طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّسَآءَ مَا لَمْ تَمَسُّوْهُنَّ اَوْ تَفْرِضُوْا لَهُنَّ فَرِیْضَةً ۖۚ وَّ مَتِّعُوْهُنَّ ۚ عَلَی الْمُوْسِعِ قَدَرُهٗ وَ عَلَی الْمُقْتِرِ قَدَرُهٗ ۚ مَتَاعًۢا بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ۚ حَقًّا عَلَی الْمُحْسِنِیْنَ۝۲۳۶

There is no blame upon you if you divorce women before you have touched them or specified for them an obligation (i.e., a dowry). But provide for them a gift - upon the wealthy according to his capacity and upon the poor according to his capacity - a provision in a just manner, a duty upon the doers of good.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 236

Footnote :

If the husband and wife do not set a dowry at the time of marriage, and they divorce before they have a chance for a private meeting, then in this situation, the husband is not obligated to pay the dowry. However, it is mandatory to give at least one pair of clothes. Giving some additional gifts is even better. (In Islamic jurisprudence, this gift is called 'mut'ah'.) If a dowry was agreed upon at the time of marriage, and then the divorce occurs before any private meeting, then half of the dowry must be paid.

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ اِنْ طَلَّقْتُمُوْهُنَّ مِنْ قَبْلِ اَنْ تَمَسُّوْهُنَّ وَ قَدْ فَرَضْتُمْ لَهُنَّ فَرِیْضَةً فَنِصْفُ مَا فَرَضْتُمْ اِلَّاۤ اَنْ یَّعْفُوْنَ اَوْ یَعْفُوَا الَّذِیْ بِیَدِهٖ عُقْدَةُ النِّكَاحِ ؕ وَ اَنْ تَعْفُوْۤا اَقْرَبُ لِلتَّقْوٰی ؕ وَ لَا تَنْسَوُا الْفَضْلَ بَیْنَكُمْ ؕ اِنَّ اللّٰهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ بَصِیْرٌ۝۲۳۷

And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation (i.e., a dowry), then [give them] half of what you have specified unless they waive it or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract (i.e., the husband) waives it. And if you [the husbands] waive it, it is closer to righteousness. And do not forget the generosity among yourselves. Indeed, Allah is all-seeing of what you do.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 237

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

حٰفِظُوْا عَلَی الصَّلَوٰتِ وَ الصَّلٰوةِ الْوُسْطٰی ۗ وَ قُوْمُوْا لِلّٰهِ قٰنِتِیْنَ۝۲۳۸

Maintain with care the prayers and [in particular] the middle prayer, and stand before Allah in total devoution.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 238

Footnote :

In the verse, the term ‘middle prayer’ (Salat al-Wusta) refers to the Asr prayer (late afternoon prayer). The reason for giving it special importance is that people are generally busy wrapping up their work and tasks during this time. Consequently, there is a significant risk of negligence in performing the prayer.

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

وَ لِلْمُطَلَّقٰتِ مَتَاعٌۢ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ ؕ حَقًّا عَلَی الْمُتَّقِیْنَ۝۲۴۱

And for divorced women is a provision in a just manner - a duty upon the righteous.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 241

Footnote :

The command to provide "benefit" to divorced women is very comprehensive. It includes maintenance during the waiting period (iddah) as well as the payment of the dowry if it has not yet been paid. Additionally, this also includes the gifts/presents given after divorce (divorce settlements).

If no dowry was specified at the time of marriage and the divorce occurs before any private meeting, then giving a gift is obligatory. However, if a dowry was agreed upon, giving a gift is not obligatory but is recommended (mustahab). Therefore, she should be given some gift in addition to her dowry.

These rulings make it clear that divorce is not a good thing. It should only be considered when no other option remains. When a divorce is given, the termination of the marital relationship should be done in a respectable, generous, and dignified manner, in a calm and composed environment, not in a hostile one.

Source : Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اِنَّ اللّٰهَ لَذُوْ فَضْلٍ عَلَی النَّاسِ وَ لٰكِنَّ اَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا یَشْكُرُوْنَ۝۲۴۳

Indeed, Allah is a possessor of bounty for the people, but most people do not show gratitude.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 243

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

مَنْ ذَا الَّذِیْ یُقْرِضُ اللّٰهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا فَیُضٰعِفَهٗ لَهٗۤ اَضْعَافًا كَثِیْرَةً ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ یَقْبِضُ وَ یَبْصُۜطُ ۪ وَ اِلَیْهِ تُرْجَعُوْنَ۝۲۴۵

Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And Allah restricts and expands (gives abundantly) and to Him you will be returned.

Surah: Al-Baqarah Ayah: 245

Footnote :

Giving a loan to Allah (SWT) means spending in His way. This includes helping the poor, as well as spending in the fields of Jihad and for religious (Deeni) needs. It is referred to as a 'loan' metaphorically, because its repayment will be given in the form of Sawab (divine reward).

The meaning of ‘excellent manner’ (or 'goodly loan') is to give with sincerity (Ikhlas) and with the intention of pleasing Allah (SWT), not to show off to people or to gain worldly return. Furthermore, even if someone gives an interest-free loan to fulfill another person's need, that may also be included in this.

The reward that Allah (SWT) will grant in the Hereafter for this charity or loan will be many times greater than the original amount. Ostensibly, giving charity or an interest-free loan carries the risk of decreasing one's wealth. Regarding this, Allah has informed us: 'Allah increases provision for whom He wills and restricts it for whom He wills. Everything is in the hands of Allah.'

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَمْ تَرَ اِلَی الَّذِیْ حَآجَّ اِبْرٰهٖمَ فِیْ رَبِّهٖۤ اَنْ اٰتٰىهُ اللّٰهُ الْمُلْكَ ۘ اِذْ قَالَ اِبْرٰهٖمُ رَبِّیَ الَّذِیْ یُحْیٖ وَ یُمِیْتُ ۙ قَالَ اَنَا اُحْیٖ وَ اُمِیْتُ ؕ قَالَ اِبْرٰهٖمُ فَاِنَّ اللّٰهَ یَاْتِیْ بِالشَّمْسِ مِنَ الْمَشْرِقِ فَاْتِ بِهَا مِنَ الْمَغْرِبِ فَبُهِتَ الَّذِیْ كَفَرَ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ لَا یَهْدِی الْقَوْمَ الظّٰلِمِیْنَۚ۝۲۵۸

Have you not considered the one who argued with Ibrahim about his Lord because Allah had given him kingship? When Ibrahim said, "My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death," he said, "I give life and cause death." Ibrahim said, "Indeed, Allah brings up the sun from the east, so bring it up from the west." So the disbeliever was dumbfounded. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 258

Footnote :

This refers to the king of Babylon, Nimrod. He claimed to be a god. His claim, "I give life and cause death," meant that because he was king, he could take the life of anyone he wished and could pardon and release those who deserved the death penalty, thus "giving them life."

It's clear that his response was not at all consistent. However, Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) saw that Nimrod either didn't understand what the creation of life and death meant, or he was deliberately engaging in a sophistical argument.

Eventually, Prophet Ibrahim said something for which Nimrod had no answer. But instead of accepting the truth when he was silenced, he first had Prophet Ibrahim arrested and then ordered him to be thrown into a fire, as described in Surah Al-Anbiya (21:68-71), Surah Al-Ankabut (29:24), and Surah As-Saffat (37:97).
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote :

His example is like that of a [smooth] stone upon which is dust; then a rainstorm strikes it, leaving it bare. They are unable to acquire anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

Footnote :

One might hope to sow a seed on a large stone if soil has gathered on it. However, if rain washes the soil away, the smooth stone becomes unfit for any cultivation. Similarly, there is hope of receiving a reward in the afterlife from giving charity. But if that charity is given to show off to people, and then the giver reminds the recipient of the favor, it washes away the charity. As a result, there is no hope of a reward.
Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

Footnote :

Some of the Ansar companions had some poor relatives, but because they were disbelievers, the companions did not help them. They were waiting for them to accept Islam, at which point they would provide help and support. Some narrations suggest that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) himself advised them to do this. Source: Tafsir-e-Tawzeehul Quran

In the Holy Quran, Allah says:

اَلَّذِیْنَ یُنْفِقُوْنَ اَمْوَالَهُمْ بِالَّیْلِ وَ النَّهَارِ سِرًّا وَّ عَلَانِیَةً فَلَهُمْ اَجْرُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ وَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَیْهِمْ وَ لَا هُمْ یَحْزَنُوْنَؔ۝۲۷۴

Those who spend their wealth [in the way of Allah] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

Surah: Al-Baqarah, Ayah: 274
